desc2: When Dustox flaps its wings, a fine dust is scattered all over. This dust is actually a powerful poison that will even make a pro wrestler sick. This Pokémon searches for food using its antennae like radar.

value.name: Shield Dust
value.desc: This Pokémon's dust blocks the additional effects of attacks taken.

name: Lotad
desc1: It searches about for clean water. If it does not drink water for too long, the leaf on its head wilts.
desc2: Its leaf grew too large for it to live on land. That is how it began to live floating in the water.

value.name: Swift Swim
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

value.name: Rain Dish
value.desc: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in rain.

name: Lombre
desc1: It is nocturnal and becomes active at nightfall. It feeds on aquatic mosses that grow in the riverbed.
desc2: It lives at the water’s edge where it is sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and becomes active at night.

value.name: Swift Swim
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

value.name: Rain Dish
value.desc: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in rain.

name: Ludicolo
desc1: The rhythm of bright, festive music activates Ludicolo’s cells, making it more powerful.
desc2: If it hears festive music, it begins moving in rhythm in order to amplify its power.

value.name: Swift Swim
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

value.name: Rain Dish
value.desc: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in rain.

name: Seedot
desc1: If it remains still, it looks just like a real nut. It delights in surprising foraging Pokémon.
desc2: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.

value.name: Chlorophyll
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

value.name: Early Bird
value.desc: The Pokémon awakens from sleep twice as fast as other Pokémon.

name: Nuzleaf
desc1: It lives deep in forests. With the leaf on its head, it makes a flute whose song makes listeners uneasy.
desc2: They live in holes bored in large trees. The sound of Nuzleaf’s grass flute fills listeners with dread.

value.name: Chlorophyll
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

value.name: Early Bird
value.desc: The Pokémon awakens from sleep twice as fast as other Pokémon.

name: Shiftry
desc1: A Pokémon that was feared as a forest guardian. It can read the foe’s mind and take preemptive action.
desc2: It lives quietly in the deep forest. It is said to create chilly winter winds with the fans it holds.

value.name: Chlorophyll
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

value.name: Early Bird
value.desc: The Pokémon awakens from sleep twice as fast as other Pokémon.

name: Taillow
desc1: Taillow courageously stands its ground against foes, however strong they may be. This gutsy Pokémon will remain defiant even after a loss. On the other hand, it cries loudly if it becomes hungry.
desc2: Taillow is young—it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This Pokémon feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.

value.name: Guts
value.desc: It's so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat.

name: Swellow
desc1: Swellow flies high above our heads, making graceful arcs in the sky. This Pokémon dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. The hapless prey is tightly grasped by Swellow’s clawed feet, preventing escape.
desc2: Swellow is very conscientious about the upkeep of its glossy wings. Once two Swellow are gathered, they diligently take care of cleaning each other’s wings.

value.name: Guts
value.desc: It's so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat.

name: Wingull
desc1: It makes its nest on sheer cliffs. Riding the sea breeze, it glides up into the expansive skies.
desc2: It soars on updrafts without flapping its wings. It makes a nest on sheer cliffs at the sea’s edge.

value.name: Keen Eye
value.desc: Keen eyes prevent other Pokémon from lowering this Pokémon's accuracy.

value.name: Hydration
value.desc: Heals status conditions if it's raining.

name: Pelipper
desc1: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokémon and eggs to safety in its bill.
desc2: Skimming the water’s surface, it dips its large bill in the sea, scoops up food and water, and carries it.

value.name: Keen Eye
value.desc: Keen eyes prevent other Pokémon from lowering this Pokémon's accuracy.

value.name: Drizzle
value.desc: The Pokémon makes it rain when it enters a battle.

name: Ralts
desc1: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.
desc2: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

value.name: Synchronize
value.desc: The attacker will receive the same status condition if it inflicts a burn, poison, or paralysis to the Pokémon.

value.name: Trace
value.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon copies an opposing Pokémon's Ability.

name: Kirlia
desc1: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.
desc2: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.

value.name: Synchronize
value.desc: The attacker will receive the same status condition if it inflicts a burn, poison, or paralysis to the Pokémon.

value.name: Trace
value.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon copies an opposing Pokémon's Ability.

name: Gardevoir
desc1: It has the power to predict the future. Its power peaks when it is protecting its Trainer.
desc2: To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.

value.name: Synchronize
value.desc: The attacker will receive the same status condition if it inflicts a burn, poison, or paralysis to the Pokémon.

value.name: Trace
value.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon copies an opposing Pokémon's Ability.

name: Surskit
desc1: If it’s in a pinch, it will secrete a sweet liquid from the tip of its head. Syrup made from gathering that liquid is tasty on bread.
desc2: It lives in ponds and marshes that feature lots of plant life. It often fights with Dewpider, whose habitat and diet are similar.

value.name: Swift Swim
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

name: Masquerain
desc1: Masquerain intimidates enemies with the eyelike patterns of its eyespots. If that doesn’t work, it deftly makes its escape on its set of four wings.
desc2: Its thin, winglike antennae are highly absorbent. It waits out rainy days in tree hollows.

value.name: Intimidate
value.desc: The Pokémon intimidates opposing Pokémon upon entering battle, lowering their Attack stat.

name: Shroomish
desc1: Shroomish live in damp soil in the dark depths of forests. They are often found keeping still under fallen leaves. This Pokémon feeds on compost that is made up of fallen, rotted leaves.
desc2: If Shroomish senses danger, it shakes its body and scatters spores from the top of its head. This Pokémon’s spores are so toxic, they make trees and weeds wilt.

value.name: Effect Spore
value.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may inflict poison, sleep,  or paralysis on its attacker.

value.name: Poison Heal
value.desc: Restores HP if the Pokémon is poisoned instead of losing HP.

name: Breloom
desc1: Breloom closes in on its foe with light and sprightly footwork, then throws punches with its stretchy arms. This Pokémon’s fighting technique puts boxers to shame.
desc2: The seeds ringing Breloom’s tail are made of hardened toxic spores. It is horrible to eat the seeds. Just taking a bite of this Pokémon’s seed will cause your stomach to rumble.

value.name: Effect Spore
value.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may inflict poison, sleep,  or paralysis on its attacker.

value.name: Poison Heal
value.desc: Restores HP if the Pokémon is poisoned instead of losing HP.

name: Slakoth
desc1: Slakoth lolls around for over 20 hours every day. Because it moves so little, it does not need much food. This Pokémon’s sole daily meal consists of just three leaves.
desc2: Slakoth’s heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens, it is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this Pokémon in motion.

value.name: Truant
value.desc: The Pokémon can't use a move if it had used a move on the previous turn.

name: Vigoroth
desc1: Vigoroth is always itching and agitated to go on a wild rampage. It simply can’t tolerate sitting still for even a minute. This Pokémon’s stress level rises if it can’t be moving constantly.
desc2: Vigoroth is simply incapable of remaining still. Even when it tries to sleep, the blood in its veins grows agitated, compelling this Pokémon to run wild throughout the jungle before it can settle down.

value.name: Vital Spirit
value.desc: The Pokémon is full of vitality, and that prevents it from falling asleep.

name: Slaking
desc1: Slaking spends all day lying down and lolling about. It eats grass growing within its reach. If it eats all the grass it can reach, this Pokémon reluctantly moves to another spot.
desc2: Wherever Slaking live, rings of over a yard in diameter appear in grassy fields. They are made by the Pokémon as it eats all the grass within reach while lying prone on the ground.

value.name: Truant
value.desc: The Pokémon can't use a move if it had used a move on the previous turn.

name: Nincada
desc1: Because it lived almost entirely underground, it is nearly blind. It uses its antennae instead.
desc2: It can sometimes live underground for more than 10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees.

value.name: Compound Eyes
value.desc: The Pokémon's compound eyes boost its accuracy.

name: Ninjask
desc1: Its cry leaves a lasting headache if heard for too long. It moves so quickly that it is almost invisible.
desc2: This Pokémon is so quick, it is said to be able to avoid any attack. It loves to feed on tree sap.

value.name: Speed Boost
value.desc: Its Speed stat is boosted every turn.

name: Shedinja
desc1: A most peculiar Pokémon that somehow appears in a Poké Ball when a Nincada evolves.
desc2: A strange Pokémon—it flies without moving its wings, has a hollow shell for a body, and does not breathe.

value.name: Wonder Guard
value.desc: Its mysterious power only lets supereffective moves hit the Pokémon.

name: Whismur
desc1: The cry of a Whismur is over 100 decibels. If you’re close to a Whismur when it lets out a cry, you’ll be stuck with an all-day headache.
desc2: When Whismur cries, the sound of its own voice startles it, making the Pokémon cry even louder. It cries until it’s exhausted, then it falls asleep.

value.name: Soundproof
value.desc: Soundproofing gives the Pokémon full immunity to all sound-based moves.

name: Loudred
desc1: Loudred’s ears serve as speakers, and they can put out sound waves powerful enough to blow away a house.
desc2: The force of this Pokémon’s loud voice isn’t just the sound—it’s also the wave of air pressure that blows opponents away and damages them.

value.name: Soundproof
value.desc: Soundproofing gives the Pokémon full immunity to all sound-based moves.

name: Exploud
desc1: In the past, people would use the loud voices of these Pokémon as a means of communication between distant cities.
desc2: This Pokémon can do more than just shout. To communicate with others of its kind, it’ll emit all sorts of sounds from the holes in its body.

value.name: Soundproof
value.desc: Soundproofing gives the Pokémon full immunity to all sound-based moves.

name: Makuhita
desc1: It practices its slaps by repeatedly slapping tree trunks. It has been known to slap an Exeggutor and get flung away.
desc2: There’s a rumor of a traditional recipe for stew that Trainers can use to raise strong Makuhita.

value.name: Guts
value.desc: It's so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat.

value.name: Thick Fat
value.desc: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat,  which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.

name: Hariyama
desc1: Although they enjoy comparing their strength, they’re also kind. They value etiquette, praising opponents they battle.
desc2: Hariyama that are big and fat aren’t necessarily strong. There are some small ones that move nimbly and use moves skillfully.

value.name: Guts
value.desc: It's so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat.

value.name: Thick Fat
value.desc: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat,  which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.

name: Azurill
desc1: The ball on Azurill’s tail bounces like a rubber ball, and it’s full of the nutrients the Pokémon needs to grow.
desc2: Although Azurill are normally docile, an angry one will swing around the big ball on its tail and try to smash its opponents.

value.name: Thick Fat
value.desc: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat,  which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.

value.name: Huge Power

name: Nosepass
desc1: It moves less than an inch a year, but when it’s in a jam, it will spin and drill down into the ground in a split second.
desc2: It hunts without twitching a muscle by pulling in its prey with powerful magnetism. But sometimes it pulls natural enemies in close.

value.name: Sturdy
value.desc: It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.

value.name: Magnet Pull
value.desc: Prevents Steel-type Pokémon from escaping using its magnetic force.

name: Skitty
desc1: Skitty has the habit of becoming fascinated by moving objects and chasing them around. This Pokémon is known to chase after its own tail and become dizzy.
desc2: Skitty is known to chase around playfully after its own tail. In the wild, this Pokémon lives in holes in the trees of forests. It is very popular as a pet because of its adorable looks.

value.name: Cute Charm
value.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may cause infatuation.

value.name: Normalize
value.desc: All the Pokémon's moves become Normal type.  The power of those moves is boosted a little.

name: Delcatty
desc1: Delcatty prefers to live an unfettered existence in which it can do as it pleases at its own pace. Because this Pokémon eats and sleeps whenever it decides, its daily routines are completely random.
desc2: Delcatty sleeps anywhere it wants without keeping a permanent nest. If other Pokémon approach it as it sleeps, this Pokémon will never fight—it will just move away somewhere else.

value.name: Cute Charm
value.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may cause infatuation.

value.name: Normalize
value.desc: All the Pokémon's moves become Normal type.  The power of those moves is boosted a little.

name: Sableye
desc1: This Pokémon is feared. When its gemstone eyes begin to glow with a sinister shine, it’s believed that Sableye will steal people’s spirits away.
desc2: It feeds on gemstone crystals. In darkness, its eyes sparkle with the glitter of jewels.

value.name: Keen Eye
value.desc: Keen eyes prevent other Pokémon from lowering this Pokémon's accuracy.

value.name: Stall
value.desc: The Pokémon moves after all other Pokémon do.

name: Mawile
desc1: It uses its docile-looking face to lull foes into complacency, then bites with its huge, relentless jaws.
desc2: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.

value.name: Intimidate
value.desc: The Pokémon intimidates opposing Pokémon upon entering battle, lowering their Attack stat.

value.name: Hyper Cutter
value.desc: The Pokémon's proud of its powerful pincers. They prevent other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.

name: Aron
desc1: It eats iron ore—and sometimes railroad tracks— to build up the steel armor that protects its body.
desc2: When Aron evolves, its steel armor peels off. In ancient times, people would collect Aron’s shed armor and make good use of it in their daily lives.

value.name: Rock Head
value.desc: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

value.name: Sturdy
value.desc: It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.

name: Lairon
desc1: Lairon live in mountains brimming with spring water and iron ore, so these Pokémon often came into conflict with humans in the past.
desc2: During territorial disputes, Lairon fight by slamming into each other. Close inspection of their steel armor reveals scratches and dents.

value.name: Rock Head
value.desc: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

value.name: Sturdy
value.desc: It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.

name: Aggron
desc1: Aggron has a horn sharp enough to perforate thick iron sheets. It brings down its opponents by ramming into them horn first.
desc2: Long ago, there was a king who wore a helmet meant to resemble the head of an Aggron. He was trying to channel the Pokémon’s strength.

value.name: Rock Head
value.desc: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

value.name: Sturdy
value.desc: It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.

name: Meditite
desc1: Meditite undertakes rigorous mental training deep in the mountains. However, whenever it meditates, this Pokémon always loses its concentration and focus. As a result, its training never ends.
desc2: Meditite heightens its inner energy through meditation. It survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another aspect of this Pokémon’s training.

value.name: Pure Power
value.desc: Using its pure power, the Pokémon doubles its Attack stat.

name: Medicham
desc1: It is said that through meditation, Medicham heightens energy inside its body and sharpens its sixth sense. This Pokémon hides its presence by merging itself with fields and mountains.
desc2: Through the power of meditation, Medicham developed its sixth sense. It gained the ability to use psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon is known to meditate for a whole month without eating.

value.name: Pure Power
value.desc: Using its pure power, the Pokémon doubles its Attack stat.

name: Electrike
desc1: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.
desc2: It stores electricity in its fur. It gives off sparks from all over its body in seasons when the air is dry.

value.name: Static
value.desc: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity, so contact with it may cause paralysis.

value.name: Lightning Rod
value.desc: The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves.  Instead of being hit by Electric-type moves,  it boosts its Sp. Atk.

name: Manectric
desc1: It stimulates its own muscles with electricity, so it can move quickly. It eases its soreness with electricity, too, so it can recover quickly as well.
desc2: It rarely appears before people. It is said to nest where lightning has fallen.

value.name: Static
value.desc: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity, so contact with it may cause paralysis.

value.name: Lightning Rod
value.desc: The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves.  Instead of being hit by Electric-type moves,  it boosts its Sp. Atk.

name: Plusle
desc1: Plusle always acts as a cheerleader for its partners. Whenever a teammate puts out a good effort in battle, this Pokémon shorts out its body to create the crackling noises of sparks to show its joy.
desc2: When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric sparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokémon cries loudly.

value.name: Plus
value.desc: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

name: Minun
desc1: Minun is more concerned about cheering on its partners than its own safety. It shorts out the electricity in its body to create brilliant showers of sparks to cheer on its teammates.
desc2: Minun loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks from its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble, this Pokémon gives off increasing amounts of sparks.

value.name: Minus
value.desc: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

name: Volbeat
desc1: With the arrival of night, Volbeat emits light from its tail. It communicates with others by adjusting the intensity and flashing of its light. This Pokémon is attracted by the sweet aroma of Illumise.
desc2: Volbeat’s tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This Pokémon loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.

value.name: Swarm
value.desc: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

value.name: Illuminate
value.desc: Raises the likelihood of meeting wild Pokémon by illuminating the surroundings.

name: Illumise
desc1: Illumise attracts a swarm of Volbeat using a sweet fragrance. Once the Volbeat have gathered, this Pokémon leads the lit-up swarm in drawing geometric designs on the canvas of the night sky.
desc2: Illumise leads a flight of illuminated Volbeat to draw signs in the night sky. This Pokémon is said to earn greater respect from its peers by composing more complex designs in the sky.

value.name: Tinted Lens
value.desc: The Pokémon can use "not very effective" moves to deal regular damage.

value.name: Oblivious
value.desc: The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts.

name: Roselia
desc1: Its flowers give off a relaxing fragrance. The stronger its aroma, the healthier the Roselia is.
desc2: It uses the different poisons in each hand separately when it attacks. The stronger its aroma, the healthier it is.

value.name: Poison Point
value.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.

value.name: Natural Cure
value.desc: All status conditions heal when the Pokémon switches out.

name: Gulpin
desc1: Virtually all of Gulpin’s body is its stomach. As a result, it can swallow something its own size. This Pokémon’s stomach contains a special fluid that digests anything.
desc2: Most of Gulpin’s body is made up of its stomach—its heart and brain are very small in comparison. This Pokémon’s stomach contains special enzymes that dissolve anything.

value.name: Liquid Ooze
value.desc: The oozed liquid has a strong stench, which damages attackers using any draining move.

value.name: Sticky Hold
value.desc: Items held by the Pokémon are stuck fast and cannot be removed by other Pokémon.

name: Swalot
desc1: When Swalot spots prey, it spurts out a hideously toxic fluid from its pores and sprays the target. Once the prey has weakened, this Pokémon gulps it down whole with its cavernous mouth.
desc2: Swalot has no teeth, so what it eats, it swallows whole, no matter what. Its cavernous mouth yawns widely. An automobile tire could easily fit inside this Pokémon’s mouth.

value.name: Liquid Ooze
value.desc: The oozed liquid has a strong stench, which damages attackers using any draining move.

value.name: Sticky Hold
value.desc: Items held by the Pokémon are stuck fast and cannot be removed by other Pokémon.

name: Carvanha
desc1: It won’t attack while it’s alone—not even if it spots prey. Instead, it waits for other Carvanha to join it, and then the Pokémon attack as a group.
desc2: These Pokémon have sharp fangs and powerful jaws. Sailors avoid Carvanha dens at all costs.

value.name: Rough Skin
value.desc: This Pokémon inflicts damage with its rough skin to the attacker on contact.

name: Sharpedo
desc1: As soon as it catches the scent of prey, Sharpedo will jet seawater from its backside, hurtling toward the target to attack at 75 mph.
desc2: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sea. Any ship entering the waters Sharpedo calls home will be attacked—no exceptions.

value.name: Rough Skin
value.desc: This Pokémon inflicts damage with its rough skin to the attacker on contact.

name: Wailmer
desc1: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.
desc2: When it sucks in a large volume of seawater, it becomes like a big, bouncy ball. It eats a ton of food daily.

value.name: Oblivious
value.desc: The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts.

value.name: Water Veil
value.desc: The Pokémon is covered with a water veil, which prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.

name: Wailord
desc1: It can sometimes knock out opponents with the shock created by breaching and crashing its big body onto the water.
desc2: Its immense size is the reason for its popularity. Wailord watching is a favorite sightseeing activity in various parts of the world.

value.name: Oblivious
value.desc: The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts.

value.name: Water Veil
value.desc: The Pokémon is covered with a water veil, which prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.

name: Numel
desc1: Numel is extremely dull witted—it doesn’t notice being hit. However, it can’t stand hunger for even a second. This Pokémon’s body is a seething cauldron of boiling magma.
desc2: Numel stores magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit within its body. If it gets wet, the magma cools and hardens. In that event, the Pokémon’s body grows heavy and its movements become sluggish.

value.name: Oblivious
value.desc: The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts.

value.name: Simple
value.desc: The stat changes the Pokémon receives are doubled.

name: Camerupt
desc1: Camerupt has a volcano inside its body. Magma of 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit courses through its body. Occasionally, the humps on this Pokémon’s back erupt, spewing the superheated magma.
desc2: The humps on Camerupt’s back are formed by a transformation of its bones. They sometimes blast out molten magma. This Pokémon apparently erupts often when it is enraged.

value.name: Magma Armor
value.desc: The Pokémon is covered with hot magma, which prevents the Pokémon from becoming frozen.

value.name: Solid Rock
value.desc: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.

name: Torkoal
desc1: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.
desc2: You find abandoned coal mines full of them. They dig tirelessly in search of coal.

value.name: White Smoke
value.desc: The Pokémon is protected by its white smoke, which prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.

value.name: Drought
value.desc: Turns the sunlight harsh when the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Spoink
desc1: Spoink bounces around on its tail. The shock of its bouncing makes its heart pump. As a result, this Pokémon cannot afford to stop bouncing—if it stops, its heart will stop.
desc2: Spoink keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to amplify this Pokémon’s psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on a constant search for a bigger pearl.

value.name: Own Tempo
value.desc: This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents it from becoming confused.

value.name: Thick Fat
value.desc: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat,  which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.

name: Grumpig
desc1: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to amplify its psychic power waves for gaining total control over its foe. When this Pokémon uses its special power, its snorting breath grows labored.
desc2: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to wield its fantastic powers. When it is doing so, it dances bizarrely. This Pokémon’s black pearls are valuable as works of art.

value.name: Own Tempo
value.desc: This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents it from becoming confused.

value.name: Thick Fat
value.desc: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat,  which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.

name: Spinda
desc1: Its steps are shaky and stumbling. Walking for a long time makes it feel sick.
desc2: Each Spinda’s spot pattern is different. With its stumbling movements, it evades opponents’ attacks brilliantly!

value.name: Tangled Feet
value.desc: Raises evasiveness if the Pokémon is confused.

value.name: Own Tempo
value.desc: This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents it from becoming confused.

name: Trapinch
desc1: Its nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit in the desert. Once something has fallen in, there is no escape.
desc2: It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.

value.name: Arena Trap
value.desc: Prevents opposing Pokémon from fleeing.

value.name: Hyper Cutter
value.desc: The Pokémon's proud of its powerful pincers. They prevent other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.

name: Vibrava
desc1: The ultrasonic waves it generates by rubbing its two wings together cause severe headaches.
desc2: To help make its wings grow, it dissolves quantities of prey in its digestive juices and guzzles them down every day.

value.name: Levitate
value.desc: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

name: Flygon
desc1: This Pokémon hides in the heart of sandstorms it creates and seldom appears where people can see it.
desc2: It is nicknamed the Desert Spirit because the flapping of its wings sounds like a woman singing.

value.name: Levitate
value.desc: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

name: Cacnea
desc1: Cacnea lives in arid locations such as deserts. It releases a strong aroma from its flower to attract prey. When prey comes near, this Pokémon shoots sharp thorns from its body to bring the victim down.
desc2: The more arid and harsh the environment, the more pretty and fragrant a flower Cacnea grows. This Pokémon battles by wildly swinging its thorny arms.

value.name: Sand Veil
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in a sandstorm.

name: Cacturne
desc1: During the daytime, Cacturne remains unmoving so that it does not lose any moisture to the harsh desert sun. This Pokémon becomes active at night when the temperature drops.
desc2: If a traveler is going through a desert in the thick of night, Cacturne will follow in a ragtag group. The Pokémon are biding their time, waiting for the traveler to tire and become incapable of moving.

value.name: Sand Veil
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in a sandstorm.

name: Swablu
desc1: Its cottony wings are full of air, making them light and fluffy to the touch. Swablu takes diligent care of its wings.
desc2: Since Swablu looks like a cumulus cloud, foes can have a hard time finding it. Apparently its wings turned white over many generations.

value.name: Natural Cure
value.desc: All status conditions heal when the Pokémon switches out.

name: Altaria
desc1: As it flies in a calm and relaxed manner, Altaria performs a humming song that would enrapture any audience.
desc2: This Pokémon has a kind disposition, but if it’s provoked, it will threaten opponents with shrill cries before attacking them without mercy.

value.name: Natural Cure
value.desc: All status conditions heal when the Pokémon switches out.

name: Zangoose
desc1: Memories of battling its archrival Seviper are etched into every cell of Zangoose’s body. This Pokémon adroitly dodges attacks with incredible agility.
desc2: Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémon shares a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.

value.name: Immunity
value.desc: The immune system of the Pokémon prevents it from getting poisoned.

name: Seviper
desc1: Seviper shares a generations-long feud with Zangoose. The scars on its body are evidence of vicious battles. This Pokémon attacks using its sword-edged tail.
desc2: Seviper’s swordlike tail serves two purposes—it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This Pokémon will not give up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose.

value.name: Shed Skin
value.desc: The Pokémon may heal its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

name: Lunatone
desc1: The phase of the moon apparently has some effect on its power. It’s active on the night of a full moon.
desc2: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.

value.name: Levitate
value.desc: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

name: Solrock
desc1: When it rotates itself, it gives off light similar to the sun, thus blinding its foes.
desc2: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.

value.name: Levitate
value.desc: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

name: Barboach
desc1: Its slimy body is hard to grasp. In one region, it is said to have been born from hardened mud.
desc2: It probes muddy riverbeds with its two long whiskers. A slimy film protects its body.

value.name: Oblivious
value.desc: The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts.

value.name: Anticipation
value.desc: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon's dangerous moves.

name: Whiscash
desc1: It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps. It will eat anything—if it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.
desc2: It claims a large swamp to itself. If a foe comes near it, it sets off tremors by thrashing around.

value.name: Oblivious
value.desc: The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts.

value.name: Anticipation
value.desc: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon's dangerous moves.

name: Corphish
desc1: No matter how dirty the water in the river, it will adapt and thrive. It has a strong will to survive.
desc2: It was originally a Pokémon from afar that escaped to the wild. It can adapt to the dirtiest river.

value.name: Shell Armor
value.desc: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

value.name: Hyper Cutter
value.desc: The Pokémon's proud of its powerful pincers. They prevent other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.

name: Crawdaunt
desc1: A rough customer that wildly flails its giant claws. It is said to be extremely hard to raise.
desc2: A brutish Pokémon that loves to battle. It will crash itself into any foe that approaches its nest.

value.name: Shell Armor
value.desc: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

value.name: Hyper Cutter
value.desc: The Pokémon's proud of its powerful pincers. They prevent other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.

name: Baltoy
desc1: It moves while spinning around on its single foot. Some Baltoy have been seen spinning on their heads.
desc2: It was discovered in ancient ruins. While moving, it constantly spins. It stands on one foot even when asleep.

value.name: Levitate
value.desc: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

name: Claydol

desc2: It appears to have been born from clay dolls made by ancient people. It uses telekinesis to float and move.

value.name: Levitate
value.desc: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

name: Lileep
desc1: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. Lileep once lived in warm seas that existed approximately 100,000,000 years ago.
desc2: Lileep clings to rocks on the seabed. When prey comes close, this Pokémon entangles it with petallike tentacles.

value.name: Suction Cups
value.desc: This Pokémon uses suction cups to stay in one spot to negate all moves and items that force switching out.

name: Cradily
desc1: It has short legs and can’t walk very fast, but its neck and tentacles can extend to over three times their usual length to nab distant prey.
desc2: Once Cradily catches prey in its tentacles, it digests them whole and absorbs their nutrients.

value.name: Suction Cups
value.desc: This Pokémon uses suction cups to stay in one spot to negate all moves and items that force switching out.

name: Anorith
desc1: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. Anorith lived in the ocean about 100,000,000 years ago, hunting with its pair of claws.
desc2: Anorith can swim swiftly by pulling its eight wings through the water like oars on a boat. This Pokémon is an ancestor of modern bug Pokémon.

value.name: Battle Armor
value.desc: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Armaldo
desc1: After evolution, this Pokémon emerged onto land. Its lower body has become stronger, and blows from its tail are devastating.
desc2: Though it lives on land, it’s also a good swimmer. It dives into the ocean in search of prey, using its sharp claws to take down its quarry.

value.name: Battle Armor
value.desc: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Feebas
desc1: Although unattractive and unpopular, this Pokémon’s marvelous vitality has made it a subject of research.
desc2: It is a shabby and ugly Pokémon. However, it is very hardy and can survive on little water.

value.name: Oblivious
value.desc: The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts.

value.name: Swift Swim
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

name: Milotic

desc2: It’s said that a glimpse of a Milotic and its beauty will calm any hostile emotions you’re feeling.

value.name: Marvel Scale
value.desc: The Pokémon's marvelous scales boost the Defense stat if it has a status condition.

value.name: Competitive
value.desc: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat sharply when a stat is lowered.

name: Castform
desc1: Although its form changes with the weather, that is apparently the result of a chemical reaction and not the result of its own free will.
desc2: Its form changes depending on the weather. The rougher conditions get, the rougher Castform’s disposition!

value.desc: The Pokémon transforms with the weather to change its type to Water, Fire, or Ice.

name: Kecleon
desc1: It changes its hue to blend into its surroundings. If no one takes notice of it for too long, it will pout and never reveal itself.
desc2: Its color changes for concealment and also when its mood or health changes. The darker the color, the healthier it is.

value.name: Color Change
value.desc: The Pokémon's type becomes the type of the move used on it.

name: Shuppet

desc2: There’s a proverb that says, “Shun the house where Shuppet gather in the growing dusk.”

value.name: Insomnia
value.desc: The Pokémon is suffering from insomnia and cannot fall asleep.

value.name: Frisk
value.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.

name: Banette

desc2: Resentment at being cast off made it spring into being. Some say that treating it well will satisfy it, and it will once more become a stuffed toy.

value.name: Insomnia
value.desc: The Pokémon is suffering from insomnia and cannot fall asleep.

value.name: Frisk
value.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.

value.name: Levitate
value.desc: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

desc2: It seeks drifting will-o’-the-wisps and sucks them into its empty body. What happens inside is a mystery.

value.name: Pressure
value.desc: By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.

desc2: Bunches of delicious fruit grow around its neck. In warm areas, many ranches raise Tropius.

value.name: Chlorophyll
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

value.name: Solar Power
value.desc: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat in harsh sunlight, but HP decreases every turn.

desc2: In high winds, Chimecho cries as it hangs from a tree branch or the eaves of a building using a suction cup on its head. This Pokémon plucks berries with its long tail and eats them.

value.name: Levitate
value.desc: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

name: Absol

desc2: Because of this Pokémon’s ability to detect danger, people mistook Absol as a bringer of doom.

value.name: Pressure
value.desc: By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.

value.desc: The Pokémon is so lucky that the critical-hit ratios of its moves are boosted.

desc2: It tends to move in a pack with others. They cluster in a tight group to sleep in a cave.

value.desc: This Pokémon steps on the opposing Pokémon's shadow to prevent it from escaping.

desc2: It can only survive in cold areas. It bounces happily around, even in environments as cold as −150 degrees Fahrenheit.

value.name: Inner Focus
value.desc: The Pokémon's intensely focused, and that protects the Pokémon from flinching.

value.name: Ice Body
value.desc: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in a hailstorm.

name: Glalie

value.name: Inner Focus
value.desc: The Pokémon's intensely focused, and that protects the Pokémon from flinching.

value.name: Ice Body
value.desc: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in a hailstorm.

value.name: Ice Body
value.desc: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in a hailstorm.

value.name: Thick Fat
value.desc: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat,  which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.

value.name: Shell Armor

value.name: Swift Swim

value.name: Swift Swim
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

value.name: Rock Head

desc2: Luvdisc makes its home in coral reefs in warm seas. It especially likes sleeping in the space between Corsola’s branches.

value.name: Swift Swim
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

desc2: Bagon is a solitary Pokémon that doesn’t form groups with others of its kind. It also has a head hard enough to cleave a boulder in one strike.

value.name: Rock Head
value.desc: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

value.name: Rock Head
value.desc: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

desc2: While basking in the joy of flight generally keeps this Pokémon in high spirits, Salamence turns into an uncontrollable menace if something angers it.

value.name: Intimidate
value.desc: The Pokémon intimidates opposing Pokémon upon entering battle, lowering their Attack stat.

value.name: Clear Body
value.desc: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

value.name: Clear Body
value.desc: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

value.name: Clear Body
value.desc: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

name: Regice

value.name: Clear Body
value.desc: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

name: Registeel

desc2: It’s rumored that this Pokémon was born deep underground in the planet’s mantle and that it emerged onto the surface 10,000 years ago.

value.name: Clear Body
value.desc: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

name: Latias

desc2: Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down. The Pokémon enfolds its body with its down and refracts light to alter its appearance.

value.name: Levitate

desc2: Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a compassionate spirit. This Pokémon can fly faster than a jet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.

value.name: Levitate
value.desc: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

desc2: Kyogre is said to be the personification of the sea itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Groudon, as each sought to gain the power of nature.

value.name: Drizzle
value.desc: The Pokémon makes it rain when it enters a battle.

desc2: Through Primal Reversion and with nature’s full power, it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to erupt and expand the landmass of the world.

value.name: Drought
value.desc: Turns the sunlight harsh when the Pokémon enters a battle.

value.name: Air Lock
value.desc: Eliminates the effects of weather.

desc2: Jirachi will awaken from its sleep of a thousand years if you sing to it in a voice of purity. It is said to make true any wish that people desire.

value.name: Serene Grace

desc2: Deoxys emerged from a virus that came from space. It is highly intelligent and wields psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon shoots lasers from the crystalline organ on its chest.

value.name: Pressure
value.desc: By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.

value.name: Overgrow
value.desc: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

name: Grotle

value.name: Overgrow
value.desc: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

value.name: Overgrow
value.desc: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

name: Chimchar

name: Roserade
desc1: After captivating opponents with its sweet scent, it lashes them with its thorny whips.
desc2: The poison in its right hand is quick acting. The poison in its left hand is slow acting. Both are life threatening.

value.name: Poison Point
value.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.

value.name: Natural Cure
value.desc: All status conditions heal when the Pokémon switches out.

name: Cranidos
desc1: A primeval Pokémon, it possesses a hard and sturdy skull, lacking any intelligence within.
desc2: Its hard skull is its distinguishing feature. It snapped trees by headbutting them, and then it fed on their ripe berries.

value.name: Mold Breaker
value.desc: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.

name: Rampardos
desc1: In ancient times, people would dig up fossils of this Pokémon and use its skull, which is harder than steel, to make helmets.
desc2: This ancient Pokémon used headbutts skillfully. Its brain was really small, so some theories suggest that its stupidity led to its extinction.

value.name: Mold Breaker
value.desc: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.

name: Shieldon
desc1: A mild-mannered, herbivorous Pokémon, it used its face to dig up tree roots to eat. The skin on its face was plenty tough.
desc2: Although its fossils can be found in layers of primeval rock, nothing but its face has ever been discovered.

value.name: Sturdy
value.desc: It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.

name: Bastiodon
desc1: The bones of its face are huge and hard, so they were mistaken for its spine until after this Pokémon was successfully restored.
desc2: This Pokémon is from roughly 100 million years ago. Its terrifyingly tough face is harder than steel.

value.name: Sturdy
value.desc: It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.

name: Burmy
desc1: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.
desc2: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.

value.name: Shed Skin
value.desc: The Pokémon may heal its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

name: Wormadam
desc1: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.
desc2: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.

value.name: Anticipation
value.desc: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon's dangerous moves.

name: Mothim
desc1: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by Combee.
desc2: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.

value.name: Swarm
value.desc: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

name: Combee
desc1: The members of the trio spend all their time together. Each one has a slightly different taste in nectar.
desc2: It ceaselessly gathers nectar from sunrise to sundown, all for the sake of Vespiquen and the swarm.

value.name: Honey Gather
value.desc: The Pokémon may gather Honey after a battle.

name: Vespiquen
desc1: It skillfully commands its grubs in battles with its enemies. The grubs are willing to risk their lives to defend Vespiquen.
desc2: Vespiquen that give off more pheromones have larger swarms of Combee attendants.

value.name: Pressure
value.desc: By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.

name: Pachirisu
desc1: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.
desc2: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

value.name: Run Away
value.desc: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

value.name: Pickup
value.desc: The Pokémon may pick up the item an opposing Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.

name: Buizel
desc1: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.
desc2: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.

value.name: Swift Swim
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

name: Floatzel
desc1: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.
desc2: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.

value.name: Swift Swim
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

name: Cherubi
desc1: It nimbly dashes about to avoid getting pecked by bird Pokémon that would love to make off with its small, nutrient-rich storage ball.
desc2: The deeper a Cherubi’s red, the more nutrients it has stockpiled in its body. And the sweeter and tastier its small ball!

value.name: Chlorophyll
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Cherrim
desc1: As a bud, it barely moves. It sits still, placidly waiting for sunlight to appear.
desc2: Its folded petals are pretty tough. Bird Pokémon can peck at them all they want, and Cherrim won’t be bothered at all.

value.name: Flower Gift
value.desc: Boosts the Attack and Sp. Def stats of itself and allies in harsh sunlight.

name: Shellos
desc1: This Pokémon’s habitat shapes its physique. According to some theories, life in warm ocean waters causes this variation to develop.
desc2: Subjecting this Pokémon to a strong force causes it to secrete a strange purple fluid. Though harmless, the fluid is awfully sticky.

value.name: Sticky Hold
value.desc: Items held by the Pokémon are stuck fast and cannot be removed by other Pokémon.

value.name: Storm Drain
value.desc: Draws in all Water-type moves. Instead of being hit by Water-type moves, it boosts its Sp. Atk.

name: Gastrodon
desc1: Its search for food sometimes leads it onto land, where it leaves behind a sticky trail of slime as it passes through.
desc2: The softness of its body helps disperse the force of impacts, so although its body is uncommonly squishy, it’s also surprisingly resilient.

value.name: Sticky Hold
value.desc: Items held by the Pokémon are stuck fast and cannot be removed by other Pokémon.

value.name: Storm Drain
value.desc: Draws in all Water-type moves. Instead of being hit by Water-type moves, it boosts its Sp. Atk.

name: Ambipom
desc1: In their search for comfortable trees, they get into territorial disputes with groups of Passimian. They win about half the time.
desc2: It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze, that’s proof it really likes you.

value.name: Pickup
value.desc: The Pokémon may pick up the item an opposing Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.

value.name: Technician
value.desc: Powers up the Pokémon's weaker moves.

name: Drifloon
desc1: Perhaps seeking company, it approaches children. However, it often quickly runs away again when the children play too roughly with it.
desc2: The gathering of many souls gave rise to this Pokémon. During humid seasons, they seem to appear in abundance.

value.name: Aftermath
value.desc: Damages the attacker if it contacts the Pokémon with a finishing hit.

value.name: Unburden
value.desc: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon's held item is used or lost.

name: Drifblim
desc1: Some say this Pokémon is a collection of souls burdened with regrets, silently drifting through the dusk.
desc2: It grabs people and Pokémon and carries them off somewhere. Where do they go? Nobody knows.

value.name: Aftermath
value.desc: Damages the attacker if it contacts the Pokémon with a finishing hit.

value.name: Unburden
value.desc: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon's held item is used or lost.

name: Buneary
desc1: If both of Buneary’s ears are rolled up, something is wrong with its body or mind. It’s a sure sign the Pokémon is in need of care.
desc2: Buneary can attack by rolling up their ears and then striking with the force created by unrolling them. This attack becomes stronger with training.

value.name: Run Away
value.desc: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

value.name: Klutz
value.desc: The Pokémon can't use any held items.

name: Lopunny
desc1: Lopunny is constantly monitoring its surroundings. If danger approaches, this Pokémon responds with superdestructive kicks.
desc2: Once hot seasons are over, Lopunny’s coat will be replaced with fur that holds a lot of insulating air in preparation for colder weather.

value.name: Cute Charm
value.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may cause infatuation.

value.name: Klutz
value.desc: The Pokémon can't use any held items.

name: Mismagius
desc1: Feared for its wrath and the curses it spreads, this Pokémon will also, on a whim, cast spells that help people.
desc2: Its muttered curses can cause awful headaches or terrifying visions that torment others.

value.name: Levitate
value.desc: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

name: Honchkrow
desc1: It will absolutely not forgive failure from or betrayal by its goons. It has no choice in this if it wants to maintain the order of the flock.
desc2: Its goons take care of most of the fighting for it. The only time it dirties its own hands is in delivering a final blow to finish off an opponent.

value.name: Insomnia
value.desc: The Pokémon is suffering from insomnia and cannot fall asleep.

value.name: Super Luck
value.desc: The Pokémon is so lucky that the critical-hit ratios of its moves are boosted.

name: Glameow
desc1: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.
desc2: When it’s happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.

value.name: Limber
value.desc: Its limber body protects the Pokémon from paralysis.

value.name: Own Tempo
value.desc: This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents it from becoming confused.

name: Purugly
desc1: It would claim another Pokémon’s nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.
desc2: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.

value.name: Own Tempo
value.desc: This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents it from becoming confused.

value.name: Thick Fat
value.desc: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat,  which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.

name: Chingling
desc1: Each time it hops, it makes a ringing sound. It deafens foes by emitting high-frequency cries.
desc2: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.

value.name: Levitate
value.desc: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

name: Stunky
desc1: From its rear, it sprays a foul-smelling liquid at opponents. It aims for their faces, and it can hit them from over 16 feet away.
desc2: If it lifts its tail and points its rear at you, beware. It’s about to spray you with a fluid stinky enough to make you faint.

value.name: Stench
value.desc: By releasing stench when attacking, this Pokémon may cause the target to flinch.

value.name: Aftermath
value.desc: Damages the attacker if it contacts the Pokémon with a finishing hit.

name: Skuntank
desc1: In its belly, it reserves stinky fluid that it shoots from its tail during battle. As this Pokémon’s diet varies, so does the stench of its fluid.
desc2: It digs holes in the ground to make its nest. The stench of the fluid it lets fly from the tip of its tail is extremely potent.

value.name: Stench
value.desc: By releasing stench when attacking, this Pokémon may cause the target to flinch.

value.name: Aftermath
value.desc: Damages the attacker if it contacts the Pokémon with a finishing hit.

name: Bronzor
desc1: It appears in ancient ruins. The pattern on its body doesn’t come from any culture in the Galar region, so it remains shrouded in mystery.
desc2: Polishing Bronzor to a shine makes its surface reflect the truth, according to common lore. Be that as it may, Bronzor hates being polished.

value.name: Levitate
value.desc: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

value.name: Heatproof
value.desc: The heatproof body of the Pokémon halves the damage from Fire-type moves that hit it.

name: Bronzong
desc1: Some believe it to be a deity that summons rain clouds. When angered, it lets out a warning cry that rings out like the tolling of a bell.
desc2: Many scientists suspect that this Pokémon originated outside the Galar region, based on the patterns on its body.

value.name: Levitate
value.desc: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

value.name: Heatproof
value.desc: The heatproof body of the Pokémon halves the damage from Fire-type moves that hit it.

name: Bonsly
desc1: It expels both sweat and tears from its eyes. The sweat is a little salty, while the tears have a slight bitterness.
desc2: This Pokémon lives in dry, rocky areas. As its green spheres dry out, their dull luster increases.

value.name: Rock Head
value.desc: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

value.name: Sturdy
value.desc: It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.

name: Mime Jr.
desc1: It mimics everyone it sees, but it puts extra effort into copying the graceful dance steps of Mr. Rime as practice.
desc2: It looks for a Mr. Rime that’s a good dancer and carefully copies the Mr. Rime’s steps like an apprentice.

value.name: Soundproof
value.desc: Soundproofing gives the Pokémon full immunity to all sound-based moves.

value.name: Filter
value.desc: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.

name: Happiny
desc1: Mimicking Chansey, Happiny will place an egg- shaped stone in its belly pouch. Happiny will treasure this stone.
desc2: Happiny’s willing to lend its precious round stone to those it’s friendly with, but if the stone isn’t returned, Happiny will cry and throw a tantrum.

value.name: Natural Cure
value.desc: All status conditions heal when the Pokémon switches out.

value.name: Serene Grace
value.desc: Boosts the likelihood of additional effects occurring when attacking.

name: Chatot
desc1: It mimics the cries of other Pokémon to trick them into thinking it’s one of them. This way they won’t attack it.
desc2: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

value.name: Keen Eye
value.desc: Keen eyes prevent other Pokémon from lowering this Pokémon's accuracy.

value.name: Tangled Feet
value.desc: Raises evasiveness if the Pokémon is confused.

name: Spiritomb
desc1: Exactly 108 spirits gathered to become this Pokémon. Apparently there are some ill-natured spirits in the mix.
desc2: All Spiritomb’s mischief and misdeeds compelled a traveler to use a mysterious spell to bind Spiritomb to an odd keystone.

value.name: Pressure
value.desc: By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.

name: Gible
desc1: Gible prefers to stay in narrow holes in the sides of caves heated by geothermal energy. This way, Gible can stay warm even during a blizzard.
desc2: Gible attacks anything that moves, and it drags whatever it catches into the crevice that is its lair. Despite the big mouth, Gible’s stomach is small.

value.name: Sand Veil
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in a sandstorm.

name: Gabite
desc1: This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from a protrusion on either side of its head to probe pitch-dark caves.
desc2: Jewels are buried in the caves these Pokémon nest in, but you’ll be torn apart by claws and fangs the moment you enter one of these caves.

value.name: Sand Veil
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in a sandstorm.

name: Garchomp
desc1: Garchomp makes its home in volcanic mountains. It flies through the sky as fast as a jet airplane, hunting down as much prey as it can.
desc2: Garchomp is fast both underground and above. It can bring down prey and return to its den before its body has chilled from being outside.

value.name: Sand Veil
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in a sandstorm.

name: Munchlax
desc1: Stuffing itself with vast amounts of food is its only concern. Whether the food is rotten or fresh, yummy or tasteless—it does not care.
desc2: It stores food beneath its fur. It might share just one bite, but only if it really trusts you.

value.name: Pickup
value.desc: The Pokémon may pick up the item an opposing Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.

value.name: Thick Fat
value.desc: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat,  which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.

name: Riolu
desc1: It’s exceedingly energetic, with enough stamina to keep running all through the night. Taking it for walks can be a challenging experience.
desc2: It can use waves called auras to gauge how others are feeling. These same waves can also tell this Pokémon about the state of the environment.

value.name: Inner Focus
value.desc: The Pokémon's intensely focused, and that protects the Pokémon from flinching.

value.name: Steadfast
value.desc: The Pokémon's determination boosts the Speed stat each time the Pokémon flinches.

name: Lucario
desc1: It controls waves known as auras, which are powerful enough to pulverize huge rocks. It uses these waves to take down its prey.
desc2: It can tell what people are thinking. Only Trainers who have justice in their hearts can earn this Pokémon’s trust.

value.name: Inner Focus
value.desc: The Pokémon's intensely focused, and that protects the Pokémon from flinching.

value.name: Steadfast
value.desc: The Pokémon's determination boosts the Speed stat each time the Pokémon flinches.

name: Hippopotas
desc1: It moves through the sands with its mouth open, swallowing sand along with its prey. It gets rid of the sand by spouting it from its nose.
desc2: This Pokémon is active during the day and passes the cold desert nights burrowed snugly into the sand.

value.name: Sand Stream
value.desc: The Pokémon summons a sandstorm when it enters a battle.

name: Hippowdon
desc1: Stones can get stuck in the ports on their bodies. Dwebble help dislodge such stones, so Hippowdon look after these Pokémon.
desc2: When roused to violence by its rage, it spews out the quantities of sand it has swallowed and whips up a sandstorm.

value.name: Sand Stream
value.desc: The Pokémon summons a sandstorm when it enters a battle.

name: Skorupi
desc1: After burrowing into the sand, it waits patiently for prey to come near. This Pokémon and Sizzlipede share common descent.
desc2: It attacks using the claws on its tail. Once locked in its grip, its prey is unable to move as this Pokémon’s poison seeps in.

value.name: Sniper
value.desc: Powers up moves if they become critical hits when attacking.

value.name: Battle Armor
value.desc: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Drapion
desc1: Its poison is potent, but it rarely sees use. This Pokémon prefers to use physical force instead, going on rampages with its car-crushing strength.
desc2: It’s so vicious that it’s called the Sand Demon. Yet when confronted by Hippowdon, Drapion keeps a low profile and will never pick a fight.

value.name: Sniper
value.desc: Powers up moves if they become critical hits when attacking.

value.name: Battle Armor
value.desc: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Croagunk
desc1: It makes frightening noises with its poison-filled cheek sacs. When opponents flinch, Croagunk hits them with a poison jab.
desc2: Once diluted, its poison becomes medicinal. This Pokémon came into popularity after a pharmaceutical company chose it as a mascot.

value.name: Dry Skin
value.desc: Restores HP in rain or when hit by Water-type moves. Reduces HP in harsh sunlight, and increases the damage received from Fire-type moves.

value.name: Anticipation
value.desc: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon's dangerous moves.

name: Toxicroak
desc1: It bounces toward opponents and gouges them with poisonous claws. No more than a scratch is needed to knock out its adversaries.
desc2: It booms out a victory croak when its prey goes down in defeat. This Pokémon and Seismitoad are related species.

value.name: Dry Skin
value.desc: Restores HP in rain or when hit by Water-type moves. Reduces HP in harsh sunlight, and increases the damage received from Fire-type moves.

value.name: Anticipation
value.desc: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon's dangerous moves.

name: Carnivine
desc1: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.
desc2: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

value.name: Levitate
value.desc: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

name: Finneon
desc1: When night falls, their pink patterns begin to shine. They’re popular with divers, so there are resorts that feed them to keep them close.
desc2: It lures in prey with its shining tail fins. It stays near the surface during the day and moves to the depths when night falls.

value.name: Swift Swim
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

value.name: Storm Drain
value.desc: Draws in all Water-type moves. Instead of being hit by Water-type moves, it boosts its Sp. Atk.

name: Lumineon
desc1: Deep down at the bottom of the ocean, prey is scarce. Lumineon get into fierce disputes with Lanturn over food.
desc2: They traverse the deep waters as if crawling over the seafloor. The fantastic lights of its fins shine like stars in the night sky.

value.name: Swift Swim
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

value.name: Storm Drain
value.desc: Draws in all Water-type moves. Instead of being hit by Water-type moves, it boosts its Sp. Atk.

name: Mantyke
desc1: Mantyke living in Galar seem to be somewhat sluggish. The colder waters of the seas in this region may be the cause.
desc2: It swims along with a school of Remoraid, and they’ll all fight together to repel attackers.

value.name: Water Absorb
value.desc: Restores HP if hit by a Water-type move instead of taking damage.

value.name: Swift Swim
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

name: Snover
desc1: It lives on snowy mountains. It sinks its legs into the snow to absorb water and keep its own temperature down.
desc2: The berries that grow around its belly are like ice pops. Galarian Darumaka absolutely love these berries.

value.name: Snow Warning
value.desc: The Pokémon summons a hailstorm when it enters a battle.

name: Abomasnow
desc1: If it sees any packs of Darumaka going after Snover, it chases them off, swinging its sizable arms like hammers.
desc2: This Pokémon is known to bring blizzards. A shake of its massive body is enough to cause whiteout conditions.

value.name: Snow Warning
value.desc: The Pokémon summons a hailstorm when it enters a battle.

name: Weavile
desc1: They attack their quarry in packs. Prey as large as Mamoswine easily fall to the teamwork of a group of Weavile.
desc2: With its claws, it leaves behind signs for its friends to find. The number of distinct signs is said to be over 500.

value.name: Pressure
value.desc: By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.

name: Magnezone
desc1: Some say that Magnezone receives signals from space via the antenna on its head and that it’s being controlled by some mysterious being.
desc2: It’s thought that a special magnetic field changed the molecular structure of this Pokémon’s body, and that’s what caused the Pokémon’s evolution.

value.name: Sturdy
value.desc: It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.

value.name: Magnet Pull
value.desc: Prevents Steel-type Pokémon from escaping using its magnetic force.

name: Lickilicky
desc1: Lickilicky’s strange tongue can stretch to many times the length of its body. No one has figured out how Lickilicky’s tongue can stretch so far.
desc2: Lickilicky can do just about anything with its tongue, which is as dexterous as the human hand. In contrast, Lickilicky’s use of its fingers is clumsy.

value.name: Oblivious
value.desc: The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts.

value.name: Own Tempo
value.desc: This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents it from becoming confused.

name: Rhyperior
desc1: It can load up to three projectiles per arm into the holes in its hands. What launches out of those holes could be either rocks or Roggenrola.
desc2: It relies on its carapace to deflect incoming attacks and throw its enemy off balance. As soon as that happens, it drives its drill into the foe.

value.name: Lightning Rod
value.desc: The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves.  Instead of being hit by Electric-type moves,  it boosts its Sp. Atk.

value.name: Solid Rock
value.desc: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.

name: Tangrowth
desc1: Tangrowth has two arms that it can extend as it pleases. Recent research has shown that these arms are, in fact, bundles of vines.
desc2: Vine growth is accelerated for Tangrowth living in warm climates. If the vines grow long, Tangrowth shortens them by tearing parts of them off.

value.name: Chlorophyll
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

value.name: Leaf Guard
value.desc: Prevents status conditions in harsh sunlight.

name: Electivire
desc1: The amount of electrical energy this Pokémon produces is proportional to the rate of its pulse. The voltage jumps while Electivire is battling.
desc2: In terms of electrical-energy output, Electivire is one of the best among all Electric Pokémon. It discharges high-voltage currents from its tails.

value.name: Motor Drive
value.desc: Boosts its Speed stat if hit by an Electric-type move instead of taking damage.

name: Magmortar
desc1: When Magmortar inhales deeply, the fire burning in its belly intensifies, rising in temperature to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
desc2: Living in the crater of a volcano has caused this Pokémon’s body to resemble its environment— it has an organ similar to a magma chamber.

value.name: Flame Body
value.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.

name: Togekiss
desc1: These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near conflict or turmoil. In recent times, they’ve hardly been seen at all.
desc2: Known as a bringer of blessings, it’s been depicted on good-luck charms since ancient times.

value.name: Serene Grace
value.desc: Boosts the likelihood of additional effects occurring when attacking.

value.name: Hustle
value.desc: Boosts the Attack stat, but lowers accuracy.

name: Yanmega
desc1: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes’ heads instantly while flying by at high speed.
desc2: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

value.name: Tinted Lens
value.desc: The Pokémon can use "not very effective" moves to deal regular damage.

value.name: Speed Boost
value.desc: Its Speed stat is boosted every turn.

name: Leafeon
desc1: Galarians favor the distinctive aroma that drifts from this Pokémon’s leaves. There’s a popular perfume made using that scent.
desc2: This Pokémon’s tail is blade sharp, with a fantastic cutting edge that can slice right though large trees.

value.name: Leaf Guard
value.desc: Prevents status conditions in harsh sunlight.

name: Glaceon
desc1: Any who become captivated by the beauty of the snowfall that Glaceon creates will be frozen before they know it.
desc2: The coldness emanating from Glaceon causes powdery snow to form, making it quite a popular Pokémon at ski resorts.

value.name: Snow Cloak
value.desc: Boosts evasiveness in a hailstorm.

name: Gliscor
desc1: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
desc2: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

value.name: Sand Veil
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in a sandstorm.

value.name: Hyper Cutter
value.desc: The Pokémon's proud of its powerful pincers. They prevent other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.

name: Mamoswine
desc1: This Pokémon can be spotted in wall paintings from as far back as 10,000 years ago. For a while, it was thought to have gone extinct.
desc2: It looks strong, and that’s exactly what it is. As the weather grows colder, its ice tusks grow longer, thicker, and more impressive.

value.name: Oblivious
value.desc: The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts.

value.name: Snow Cloak
value.desc: Boosts evasiveness in a hailstorm.

name: Porygon-Z
desc1: Porygon-Z had a program installed to allow it to move between dimensions, but the program also caused instability in Porygon-Z’s behavior.
desc2: Some say an additional program made this Pokémon evolve, but even academics can’t agree on whether Porygon-Z is really an evolution.

value.name: Adaptability
value.desc: Powers up moves of the same type as the Pokémon.

value.name: Download
value.desc: Compares an opposing Pokémon's Defense and Sp. Def stats before raising its own Attack or Sp. Atk stat—whichever will be more effective.

name: Gallade
desc1: True to its honorable-warrior image, it uses the blades on its elbows only in defense of something or someone.
desc2: Sharply attuned to others’ wishes for help, this Pokémon seeks out those in need and aids them in battle.

value.name: Steadfast
value.desc: The Pokémon's determination boosts the Speed stat each time the Pokémon flinches.

name: Probopass
desc1: Although it can control its units known as Mini-Noses, they sometimes get lost and don’t come back.
desc2: It uses three small units to catch prey and battle enemies. The main body mostly just gives orders.

desc2: The deeper the color of a Petilil’s leaves, the healthier the Pokémon is. Petilil sometimes makes its home in a well-tended field or flowerbed.

value.name: Chlorophyll

name: Lilligant

value.name: Chlorophyll

value.name: Intimidate

desc2: It’s said that Malamar’s hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.
