value.desc: This Pokémon uses suction cups to stay in one spot to negate all moves and items that force switching out.

value.name: Contrary
value.desc: Makes stat changes have an opposite effect.

name: Binacle
desc1: After two Binacle find a suitably sized rock, they adhere themselves to it and live together. They cooperate to gather food during high tide.
desc2: If the two don’t work well together, both their offense and defense fall apart. Without good teamwork, they won’t survive.

value.name: Sniper
value.desc: Powers up moves if they become critical hits when attacking.

value.name: Tough Claws
value.desc: Powers up moves that make direct contact.

name: Barbaracle
desc1: Seven Binacle come together to form one Barbaracle. The Binacle that serves as the head gives orders to those serving as the limbs.
desc2: Having an eye on each palm allows it to keep watch in all directions. In a pinch, its limbs start to act on their own to ensure the enemy’s defeat.

value.name: Sniper
value.desc: Powers up moves if they become critical hits when attacking.

value.name: Tough Claws
value.desc: Powers up moves that make direct contact.

name: Skrelp
desc1: It drifts in the ocean, blending in with floating seaweed. When other Pokémon come to feast on the seaweed, Skrelp feasts on them instead.
desc2: Skrelp looks like a piece of rotten seaweed, so it can blend in with seaweed drifting on the ocean and avoid being detected by enemies.

value.name: Poison Point
value.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.

value.name: Poison Touch
value.desc: May poison a target when the Pokémon makes contact.

name: Dragalge
desc1: Dragalge uses a poisonous liquid capable of corroding metal to send tankers that enter its territory to the bottom of the sea.
desc2: Dragalge generates dragon energy by sticking the plume on its head out above the ocean’s surface and bathing it in sunlight.

value.name: Poison Point
value.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.

value.name: Poison Touch
value.desc: May poison a target when the Pokémon makes contact.

name: Clauncher
desc1: Clauncher’s claws can fall off during battle, but they’ll regenerate. The meat inside the claws is popular as a delicacy in Galar.
desc2: By detonating gas that accumulates in its right claw, this Pokémon launches water like a bullet. This is how Clauncher defeats its enemies.

value.name: Mega Launcher
value.desc: Powers up aura and pulse moves.

name: Clawitzer
desc1: After using the feelers on its oversized claw to detect the location of prey, Clawitzer launches a cannonball of water at its target.
desc2: Clawitzer’s right arm is a cannon that launches projectiles made of seawater. Shots from a Clawitzer’s cannon arm can sink a tanker.

value.name: Mega Launcher
value.desc: Powers up aura and pulse moves.

name: Helioptile
desc1: When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon’s electric moves.
desc2: The sun powers this Pokémon’s electricity generation. Interruption of that process stresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.

value.name: Sand Veil
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in a sandstorm.

value.name: Dry Skin
value.desc: Restores HP in rain or when hit by Water-type moves. Reduces HP in harsh sunlight, and increases the damage received from Fire-type moves.

name: Heliolisk
desc1: A now-vanished desert culture treasured these Pokémon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to the Galar region, treasure came with them.
desc2: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.

value.name: Sand Veil
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in a sandstorm.

value.name: Dry Skin
value.desc: Restores HP in rain or when hit by Water-type moves. Reduces HP in harsh sunlight, and increases the damage received from Fire-type moves.

name: Tyrunt
desc1: This is an ancient Pokémon, revived in modern times. It has a violent disposition, and it’ll tear apart anything it gets between its hefty jaws.
desc2: This Pokémon is selfish and likes to be pampered. It can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer just by playing around.

value.name: Strong Jaw
value.desc: The Pokémon's strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.

name: Tyrantrum
desc1: This Pokémon is from about 100,000,000 years ago. It has the presence of a king, vicious but magnificent.
desc2: A single bite of Tyrantrum’s massive jaws will demolish a car. This Pokémon was the king of the ancient world.

value.name: Strong Jaw
value.desc: The Pokémon's strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.

name: Amaura
desc1: This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. In the past, it lived with others of its kind in cold lands where there were fewer predators.
desc2: Amaura is an ancient Pokémon that has gone extinct. Specimens of this species can sometimes be found frozen in ice.

value.name: Refrigerate
value.desc: Normal-type moves become Ice-type moves.  The power of those moves is boosted a little.

name: Aurorus
desc1: Aurorus was restored from a fossil. It’s said that when this Pokémon howls, auroras appear in the night sky.
desc2: When gripped by rage, Aurorus will emanate freezing air, covering everything around it in ice.

value.name: Refrigerate
value.desc: Normal-type moves become Ice-type moves.  The power of those moves is boosted a little.

name: Sylveon
desc1: By releasing enmity-erasing waves from its ribbonlike feelers, Sylveon stops any conflict.
desc2: There’s a Galarian fairy tale that describes a beautiful Sylveon vanquishing a dreadful dragon Pokémon.

value.name: Cute Charm
value.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may cause infatuation.

name: Hawlucha
desc1: It drives its opponents to exhaustion with its agile maneuvers, then ends the fight with a flashy finishing move.
desc2: It always strikes a pose before going for its finishing move. Sometimes opponents take advantage of that time to counterattack.

value.name: Limber
value.desc: Its limber body protects the Pokémon from paralysis.

value.name: Unburden
value.desc: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon's held item is used or lost.

name: Dedenne

desc2: Since Dedenne can’t generate much electricity on its own, it steals electricity from outlets or other electric Pokémon.

value.name: Pickup
value.desc: The Pokémon may pick up the item an opposing Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.

value.name: Cheek Pouch
value.desc: Restores HP as well when the Pokémon eats a Berry.

name: Carbink

desc2: It’s said that somewhere in the world, there’s a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering Carbink. It’s also said that this pack has a queen.

value.name: Clear Body
value.desc: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

name: Goomy
desc1: Because most of its body is water, it will dry up if the weather becomes too arid. It’s considered the weakest dragon Pokémon.
desc2: Their horns are powerful sensors. As soon as Goomy pick up any sign of enemies, they go into hiding. This is how they’ve survived.

value.name: Hydration
value.desc: Heals status conditions if it's raining.

value.name: Sap Sipper
value.desc: Boosts the Attack stat if hit by a Grass-type move instead of taking damage.

name: Sliggoo
desc1: Although this Pokémon isn’t very strong, its body is coated in a caustic slime that can melt through anything, so predators steer clear of it.
desc2: The lump on its back contains its tiny brain. It thinks only of food and escaping its enemies.

value.name: Hydration
value.desc: Heals status conditions if it's raining.

value.name: Sap Sipper
value.desc: Boosts the Attack stat if hit by a Grass-type move instead of taking damage.

name: Goodra
desc1: Sometimes it misunderstands instructions and appears dazed or bewildered. Many Trainers don’t mind, finding this behavior to be adorable.
desc2: Its form of offense is forcefully stretching out its horns. The strikes land 100 times harder than any blow from a heavyweight boxer.

value.name: Hydration
value.desc: Heals status conditions if it's raining.

value.name: Sap Sipper
value.desc: Boosts the Attack stat if hit by a Grass-type move instead of taking damage.

name: Klefki

desc2: Klefki sucks in metal ions with the horn topping its head. It seems this Pokémon loves keys so much that its head needed to look like one, too.

value.name: Prankster
value.desc: Gives priority to a status move.

desc2: With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.

value.name: Natural Cure
value.desc: All status conditions heal when the Pokémon switches out.

value.name: Frisk
value.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.

name: Trevenant
desc1: People fear it due to a belief that it devours any who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the Pokémon it shares its woods with, it’s kind.
desc2: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.

value.name: Natural Cure
value.desc: All status conditions heal when the Pokémon switches out.

value.name: Frisk
value.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.

name: Pumpkaboo

desc2: The light that streams out from the holes in the pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people and Pokémon that see it.

value.desc: The Pokémon may pick up the item an opposing Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.

value.name: Frisk
value.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.

desc2: In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist will come knocking. Whoever answers the door will be swept off to the afterlife.

value.name: Pickup
value.desc: The Pokémon may pick up the item an opposing Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.

value.name: Frisk
value.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.

desc2: This Pokémon lives in areas of frigid cold. It secures itself to the back of an Avalugg by freezing its feet in place.

value.name: Own Tempo
value.desc: This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents it from becoming confused.

value.name: Ice Body
value.desc: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in a hailstorm.

desc2: As Avalugg moves about during the day, the cracks in its body deepen. The Pokémon’s body returns to a pristine state overnight.

value.name: Own Tempo
value.desc: This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents it from becoming confused.

value.name: Ice Body
value.desc: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in a hailstorm.

name: Noibat
desc1: After nightfall, they emerge from the caves they nest in during the day. Using their ultrasonic waves, they go on the hunt for ripened fruit.
desc2: No wavelength of sound is beyond Noibat’s ability to produce. The ultrasonic waves it generates can overcome much larger Pokémon.

value.name: Frisk
value.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.

value.name: Infiltrator
value.desc: Passes through the opposing Pokémon's barrier,  substitute, and the like and strikes.

name: Noivern
desc1: Aggressive and cruel, this Pokémon will ruthlessly torment enemies that are helpless in the dark.
desc2: Flying through the darkness, it weakens enemies with ultrasonic waves that could crush stone. Its fangs finish the fight.

value.name: Frisk
value.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.

value.name: Infiltrator
value.desc: Passes through the opposing Pokémon's barrier,  substitute, and the like and strikes.

value.name: Fairy Aura
value.desc: Powers up each Pokémon's Fairy-type moves.

name: Yveltal
desc1: When this legendary Pokémon’s wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.
desc2: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

value.name: Dark Aura
value.desc: Powers up each Pokémon's Dark-type moves.

name: Zygarde

desc2: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.

value.name: Aura Break
value.desc: The effects of "Aura" Abilities are reversed to lower the power of affected moves.

name: Diancie

value.name: Clear Body
value.desc: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

desc2: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.

value.name: Magician
value.desc: The Pokémon steals the held item of a Pokémon it hits with a move.

value.desc: Restores HP if hit by a Water-type move instead of taking damage.

value.name: Overgrow
value.desc: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

name: Dartrix
desc1: This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don’t groom it diligently, it will stop listening to you.
desc2: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.

value.name: Overgrow
value.desc: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

desc2: Decidueye can nock and fire an arrow at an enemy in a tenth of a second, so its battles are decided in the blink of an eye.

value.name: Overgrow
value.desc: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

desc2: Its coat regrows twice a year. When the time comes, Litten sets its own body on fire and burns away the old fur.

value.name: Blaze
value.desc: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

value.name: Blaze
value.desc: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

value.name: Blaze
value.desc: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

value.name: Torrent
value.desc: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

value.name: Torrent
value.desc: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

value.name: Torrent
value.desc: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

value.name: Keen Eye
value.desc: Keen eyes prevent other Pokémon from lowering this Pokémon's accuracy.

name: Yungoos

name: Gumshoos

value.name: Strong Jaw

value.desc: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

name: Crabrawler

value.desc: The Pokémon's proud of its powerful pincers. They prevent other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.

value.name: Hyper Cutter
value.desc: The Pokémon's proud of its powerful pincers. They prevent other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.

value.name: Shield Dust

value.desc: The Pokémon may gather Honey after a battle.

name: Rockruff

value.name: Keen Eye

value.desc: The Pokémon is full of vitality, and that prevents it from falling asleep.

name: Lycanroc

desc2: With swift movements, this Pokémon gradually backs its prey into a corner. Lycanroc’s fangs are always aimed toward opponents’ weak spots.

value.name: Keen Eye

value.desc: When it has a lot of HP, the Pokémon forms a powerful school. It stops schooling when its HP is low.

value.desc: Lowers the power of Fire-type moves done to the Pokémon and prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.

value.desc: Raises the likelihood of meeting wild Pokémon by illuminating the surroundings.

name: Salandit
desc1: Its venom sacs produce a fluid that this Pokémon then heats up with the flame in its tail. This process creates Salandit’s poisonous gas.
desc2: This sneaky Pokémon will slink behind its prey and immobilize it with poisonous gas before the prey even realizes Salandit is there.

value.name: Corrosion
value.desc: The Pokémon can poison the target even if it's a Steel or Poison type.

name: Salazzle
desc1: Only female Salazzle exist. They emit a gas laden with pheromones to captivate male Salandit.
desc2: The winner of competitions between Salazzle is decided by which one has the most male Salandit with it.

value.name: Corrosion
value.desc: The Pokémon can poison the target even if it's a Steel or Poison type.

name: Stufful
desc1: Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out to touch this Pokémon could result in painful retaliation.
desc2: The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.

value.name: Klutz
value.desc: The Pokémon can't use any held items.

value.name: Fluffy
value.desc: Halves the damage taken from moves that make direct contact, but doubles that of Fire-type moves.

name: Bewear
desc1: Once it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show its affection with a hug. Letting it do that is dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.
desc2: The moves it uses to take down its prey would make a martial artist jealous. It tucks subdued prey under its arms to carry them to its nest.

value.name: Klutz
value.desc: The Pokémon can't use any held items.

value.name: Fluffy
value.desc: Halves the damage taken from moves that make direct contact, but doubles that of Fire-type moves.

name: Bounsweet
desc1: Its body gives off a sweet, fruity scent that is extremely appetizing to bird Pokémon.
desc2: When under attack, it secretes a sweet and delicious sweat. The scent only calls more enemies to it.

value.name: Oblivious
value.desc: The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts.

value.name: Leaf Guard
value.desc: Prevents status conditions in harsh sunlight.

name: Steenee
desc1: As it twirls like a dancer, a sweet smell spreads out around it. Anyone who inhales the scent will feel a surge of happiness.
desc2: Any Corvisquire that pecks at this Pokémon will be greeted with a smack from its sepals followed by a sharp kick.

value.name: Oblivious
value.desc: The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts.

value.name: Leaf Guard
value.desc: Prevents status conditions in harsh sunlight.

name: Tsareena
desc1: This feared Pokémon has long, slender legs and a cruel heart. It shows no mercy as it stomps on its opponents.
desc2: A kick from the hardened tips of this Pokémon’s legs leaves a wound in the opponent’s body and soul that will never heal.

value.name: Leaf Guard
value.desc: Prevents status conditions in harsh sunlight.

value.name: Queenly Majesty
value.desc: Its majesty pressures the opposing Pokémon,  making it unable to attack using priority moves.

name: Comfey
desc1: Comfey picks flowers with its vine and decorates itself with them. For some reason, flowers won’t wither once they’re attached to a Comfey.
desc2: These Pokémon smell very nice. All Comfey wear different flowers, so each of these Pokémon has its own individual scent.

value.name: Flower Veil
value.desc: Ally Grass-type Pokémon are protected from status conditions and the lowering of their stats.

value.name: Triage
value.desc: Gives priority to a healing move.

name: Oranguru
desc1: With waves of its fan—made from leaves and its own fur—Oranguru skillfully gives instructions to other Pokémon.
desc2: It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes across a wounded Pokémon, Oranguru will gather medicinal herbs to treat it.

value.name: Inner Focus
value.desc: The Pokémon's intensely focused, and that protects the Pokémon from flinching.

value.name: Telepathy
value.desc: Anticipates an ally's attack and dodges it.

name: Passimian
desc1: Displaying amazing teamwork, they follow the orders of their boss as they all help out in the search for their favorite berries.
desc2: Passimian live in groups of about 20, with each member performing an assigned role. Through cooperation, the group survives.

value.name: Receiver
value.desc: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.

name: Wimpod
desc1: It’s nature’s cleaner—it eats anything and everything, including garbage and rotten things. The ground near its nest is always clean.
desc2: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy’s presence.

value.name: Wimp Out
value.desc: The Pokémon cowardly switches out when its HP becomes half or less.

name: Golisopod
desc1: It will do anything to win, taking advantage of every opening and finishing opponents off with the small claws on its front legs.
desc2: They live in sunken ships or in holes in the seabed. When Golisopod and Grapploct battle, the loser becomes the winner’s meal.

value.name: Emergency Exit
value.desc: The Pokémon, sensing danger, switches out when its HP becomes half or less.

name: Sandygast
desc1: Grudges of the dead have possessed a mound of sand and become a Pokémon. Sandygast is fond of the shovel on its head.
desc2: Sandygast mainly inhabits beaches. It takes control of anyone who puts their hand into its mouth, forcing them to make its body bigger.

value.name: Water Compaction
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Defense stat sharply when hit by a Water-type move.

name: Palossand
desc1: Palossand is known as the Beach Nightmare. It pulls its prey down into the sand by controlling the sand itself, and then it sucks out their souls.
desc2: This Pokémon lives on beaches, but it hates water. Palossand can’t maintain its castle-like shape if it gets drenched by a heavy rain.

value.name: Water Compaction
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Defense stat sharply when hit by a Water-type move.

name: Pyukumuku
desc1: It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.
desc2: It’s covered in a slime that keeps its skin moist, allowing it to stay on land for days without drying up.

value.name: Innards Out
value.desc: Damages the attacker landing the finishing hit by the amount equal to its last HP.

name: Type: Null
desc1: Rumor has it that the theft of top-secret research notes led to a new instance of this Pokémon being created in the Galar region.
desc2: It was modeled after a mighty Pokémon of myth. The mask placed upon it limits its power in order to keep it under control.

value.name: Battle Armor
value.desc: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Silvally
desc1: A solid bond of trust between this Pokémon and its Trainer awakened the strength hidden within Silvally. It can change its type at will.
desc2: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

value.name: RKS System
value.desc: Changes the Pokémon's type to match the memory disc it holds.

name: Minior
desc1: It lives in the ozone layer, where it becomes food for stronger Pokémon. When it tries to run away, it falls to the ground.
desc2: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.

value.name: Shields Down
value.desc: When its HP becomes half or less, the Pokémon's shell breaks and it becomes aggressive.

name: Komala
desc1: It stays asleep from the moment it’s born. When it falls into a deep sleep, it stops moving altogether.
desc2: It remains asleep from birth to death as a result of the sedative properties of the leaves that form its diet.

value.name: Comatose
value.desc: It's always drowsing and will never wake up.  It can attack without waking up.

name: Turtonator
desc1: Explosive substances coat the shell on its back. Enemies that dare attack it will be blown away by an immense detonation.
desc2: Eating sulfur in its volcanic habitat is what causes explosive compounds to develop in its shell. Its droppings are also dangerously explosive.

value.name: Shell Armor
value.desc: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Togedemaru
desc1: With the long hairs on its back, this Pokémon takes in electricity from other electric Pokémon. It stores what it absorbs in an electric sac.
desc2: When it’s in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.

value.name: Lightning Rod
value.desc: The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves.  Instead of being hit by Electric-type moves,  it boosts its Sp. Atk.

value.name: Iron Barbs
value.desc: Inflicts damage on the attacker upon contact with iron barbs.

name: Mimikyu
desc1: It wears a rag fashioned into a Pikachu costume in an effort to look less scary. Unfortunately, the costume only makes it creepier.
desc2: There was a scientist who peeked under Mimikyu’s old rag in the name of research. The scientist died of a mysterious disease.

value.name: Disguise
value.desc: Once per battle, the shroud that covers the Pokémon can protect it from an attack.

name: Bruxish
desc1: It burrows beneath the sand, radiating psychic power from the protuberance on its head. It waits for prey as it surveys the area.
desc2: Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie’s spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches up the spikes and eats them.

value.name: Strong Jaw
value.desc: The Pokémon's strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.

value.name: Dazzling
value.desc: Surprises the opposing Pokémon, making it unable to attack using priority moves.

name: Drampa
desc1: The mountains it calls home are nearly two miles in height. On rare occasions, it descends to play with the children living in the towns below.
desc2: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until it’s angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.

value.name: Sap Sipper
value.desc: Boosts the Attack stat if hit by a Grass-type move instead of taking damage.

value.name: Berserk
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Sp. Atk stat when it takes a hit that causes its HP to become half or less.

name: Dhelmise
desc1: After a piece of seaweed merged with debris from a sunken ship, it was reborn as this ghost Pokémon.
desc2: After lowering its anchor, it waits for its prey. It catches large Wailord and drains their life-force.

value.name: Steelworker
value.desc: Powers up Steel-type moves.

name: Jangmo-o
desc1: They learn to fight by smashing their head scales together. The dueling strengthens both their skills and their spirits.
desc2: Jangmo-o strikes its scales to communicate with others of its kind. Its scales are actually fur that’s become as hard as metal.

value.name: Soundproof
value.desc: Soundproofing gives the Pokémon full immunity to all sound-based moves.

value.name: Bulletproof
value.desc: Protects the Pokémon from some ball and bomb moves.

name: Hakamo-o
desc1: The scaleless, scarred parts of its body are signs of its strength. It shows them off to defeated opponents.
desc2: Before attacking its enemies, it clashes its scales together and roars. Its sharp claws shred the opposition.

value.name: Soundproof
value.desc: Soundproofing gives the Pokémon full immunity to all sound-based moves.

value.name: Bulletproof
value.desc: Protects the Pokémon from some ball and bomb moves.

name: Kommo-o
desc1: It clatters its tail scales to unnerve opponents. This Pokémon will battle only those who stand steadfast in the face of this display.
desc2: Certain ruins have paintings of ancient warriors wearing armor made of Kommo-o scales.

value.name: Soundproof
value.desc: Soundproofing gives the Pokémon full immunity to all sound-based moves.

value.name: Bulletproof
value.desc: Protects the Pokémon from some ball and bomb moves.

name: Tapu Koko
desc1: Although it’s called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.
desc2: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.

value.name: Electric Surge
value.desc: Turns the ground into Electric Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Tapu Lele
desc1: It heals the wounds of people and Pokémon by sprinkling them with its sparkling scales. This guardian deity is worshiped on Akala.
desc2: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.

value.name: Psychic Surge
value.desc: Turns the ground into Psychic Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Tapu Bulu
desc1: Although it’s called a guardian deity, it’s violent enough to crush anyone it sees as an enemy.
desc2: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula’ula controls plants.

value.name: Grassy Surge
value.desc: Turns the ground into Grassy Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Tapu Fini
desc1: This guardian deity of Poni Island manipulates water. Because it lives deep within a thick fog, it came to be both feared and revered.
desc2: Although it’s called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.

value.name: Misty Surge
value.desc: Turns the ground into Misty Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Cosmog
desc1: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn’t seem to care.
desc2: Whether or not it’s a Pokémon from this world is a mystery. When it’s in a jam, it warps away to a safe place to hide.

value.name: Unaware
value.desc: When attacking, the Pokémon ignores the target Pokémon's stat changes.

name: Cosmoem
desc1: The king who ruled Alola in times of antiquity called it the “cocoon of the stars” and built an altar to worship it.
desc2: As it absorbs light, Cosmoem continues to grow. Its golden shell is surprisingly solid.

value.name: Sturdy
value.desc: It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.

name: Solgaleo
desc1: Sometimes the result of its opening an Ultra Wormhole is that energy and life-forms from other worlds are called here to this world.
desc2: In writings from the distant past, it’s called by the name “the beast that devours the sun.”

value.name: Full Metal Body
value.desc: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

name: Lunala
desc1: Records of it exist in writings from long, long ago, where it was known by the name “the beast that calls the moon.”
desc2: It sometimes summons unknown powers and life-forms here to this world from holes that lead to other worlds.

value.name: Shadow Shield
value.desc: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes while its HP is full.

name: Nihilego
desc1: A life-form from another world, it was dubbed a UB and is thought to produce a strong neurotoxin.
desc2: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.

value.name: Beast Boost
value.desc: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.

name: Buzzwole
desc1: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
desc2: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.

value.name: Beast Boost
value.desc: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.

name: Pheromosa
desc1: A life-form that lives in another world, its body is thin and supple, but it also possesses great power.
desc2: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

value.name: Beast Boost
value.desc: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.

name: Xurkitree
desc1: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
desc2: They’ve been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.

value.name: Beast Boost
value.desc: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.

name: Celesteela
desc1: One of the dangerous UBs, high energy readings can be detected coming from both of its huge arms.
desc2: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

value.name: Beast Boost
value.desc: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.

name: Kartana
desc1: This Ultra Beast’s body, which is as thin as paper, is like a sharpened sword.
desc2: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

value.name: Beast Boost
value.desc: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.

name: Guzzlord
desc1: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
desc2: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry—it is certainly always devouring something.

value.name: Beast Boost
value.desc: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.

name: Necrozma
desc1: It looks somehow pained as it rages around in search of light, which serves as its energy. It’s apparently from another world.
desc2: Light is the source of its energy. If it isn’t devouring light, impurities build up in it and on it, and Necrozma darkens and stops moving.

value.name: Prism Armor
value.desc: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.

name: Magearna
desc1: It synchronizes its consciousness with others to understand their feelings. This faculty makes it useful for taking care of people.
desc2: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.

value.name: Soul-Heart
value.desc: Boosts its Sp. Atk stat every time a Pokémon faints.

name: Marshadow
desc1: It slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it’s imitating.
desc2: It sinks into the shadows of people and Pokémon, where it can understand their feelings and copy their capabilities.

value.name: Technician
value.desc: Powers up the Pokémon's weaker moves.

name: Poipole
desc1: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.
desc2: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.

value.name: Beast Boost
value.desc: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.

name: Naganadel
desc1: It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.
desc2: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.

value.name: Beast Boost
value.desc: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.

name: Stakataka
desc1: It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.
desc2: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute’s true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.

value.name: Beast Boost
value.desc: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.

name: Blacephalon
desc1: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It’s apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.
desc2: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents’ surprise to rob them of their vitality.

value.name: Beast Boost
value.desc: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.

name: Zeraora
desc1: It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack, they’ll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.
desc2: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.

value.name: Volt Absorb
value.desc: Restores HP if hit by an Electric-type move instead of taking damage.

name: Meltan
desc1: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.
desc2: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.

value.name: Magnet Pull
value.desc: Prevents Steel-type Pokémon from escaping using its magnetic force.

name: Melmetal
desc1: At the end of its life-span, Melmetal will rust and fall apart. The small shards left behind will eventually be reborn as Meltan.
desc2: Centrifugal force is behind the punches of Melmetal’s heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.

value.name: Iron Fist
value.desc: Powers up punching moves.

name: Grookey
desc1: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.
desc2: It attacks with rapid beats of its stick. As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets more and more pumped.

value.name: Overgrow
value.desc: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

name: Thwackey
desc1: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.
desc2: When it’s drumming out rapid beats in battle, it gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won’t even notice that it’s already knocked out its opponent.

value.name: Overgrow
value.desc: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

name: Rillaboom
desc1: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.
desc2: The one with the best drumming techniques becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle disposition and values harmony among its group.

value.name: Overgrow
value.desc: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

name: Scorbunny
desc1: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon’s body. Once that happens, it’s ready to fight at full power.
desc2: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it’s raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.

value.name: Blaze
value.desc: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

name: Raboot
desc1: Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.
desc2: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.

value.name: Blaze
value.desc: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

name: Cinderace
desc1: It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.
desc2: It’s skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.

value.name: Blaze
value.desc: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

name: Sobble
desc1: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won’t be able to resist weeping.
desc2: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.

value.name: Torrent
value.desc: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

name: Drizzile
desc1: A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.
desc2: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.

value.name: Torrent
value.desc: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

name: Inteleon
desc1: It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.
desc2: Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes’ weak points so it can precisely blast them with water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.

value.name: Torrent
value.desc: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

name: Skwovet
desc1: Found throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely empty of berries.
desc2: It eats berries nonstop—a habit that has made it more resilient than it looks. It’ll show up on farms, searching for yet more berries.

value.name: Cheek Pouch
value.desc: Restores HP as well when the Pokémon eats a Berry.

name: Greedent
desc1: It stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that they fall out constantly. But this Pokémon is a bit slow-witted, so it doesn’t notice the loss.
desc2: Common throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon has strong teeth and can chew through the toughest of berry shells.

value.name: Cheek Pouch
value.desc: Restores HP as well when the Pokémon eats a Berry.

name: Rookidee
desc1: It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter how powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every battle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.
desc2: Jumping nimbly about, this small-bodied Pokémon takes advantage of even the slightest opportunity to disorient larger opponents.

value.name: Keen Eye
value.desc: Keen eyes prevent other Pokémon from lowering this Pokémon's accuracy.

value.name: Unnerve
value.desc: Unnerves opposing Pokémon and makes them unable to eat Berries.

name: Corvisquire
desc1: Smart enough to use tools in battle, these Pokémon have been seen picking up rocks and flinging them or using ropes to wrap up enemies.
desc2: The lessons of many harsh battles have taught it how to accurately judge an opponent’s strength.

value.name: Keen Eye
value.desc: Keen eyes prevent other Pokémon from lowering this Pokémon's accuracy.

value.name: Unnerve
value.desc: Unnerves opposing Pokémon and makes them unable to eat Berries.

name: Corviknight
desc1: This Pokémon reigns supreme in the skies of the Galar region. The black luster of its steel body could drive terror into the heart of any foe.
desc2: With their great intellect and flying skills, these Pokémon very successfully act as the Galar region’s airborne taxi service.

value.name: Pressure
value.desc: By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.

value.name: Unnerve
value.desc: Unnerves opposing Pokémon and makes them unable to eat Berries.

name: Blipbug
desc1: A constant collector of information, this Pokémon is very smart. Very strong is what it isn’t.
desc2: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.

value.name: Compound Eyes
value.desc: The Pokémon's compound eyes boost its accuracy.

value.name: Swarm
value.desc: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

name: Dottler
desc1: It barely moves, but it’s still alive. Hiding in its shell without food or water seems to have awakened its psychic powers.
desc2: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.

value.name: Compound Eyes
value.desc: The Pokémon's compound eyes boost its accuracy.

value.name: Swarm
value.desc: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

name: Orbeetle
desc1: It’s famous for its high level of intelligence, and the large size of its brain is proof that it also possesses immense psychic power.
desc2: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what’s around it—and what’s around it can include things over six miles away.

value.name: Swarm
value.desc: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

value.name: Frisk
value.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.

name: Nickit
desc1: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.
desc2: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.

value.name: Run Away
value.desc: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

value.name: Unburden
value.desc: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon's held item is used or lost.

name: Thievul
desc1: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.
desc2: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.

value.name: Run Away
value.desc: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

value.name: Unburden
value.desc: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon's held item is used or lost.

name: Gossifleur
desc1: It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.
desc2: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.

value.name: Regenerator
value.desc: Restores a little HP when withdrawn from battle.

value.name: Cotton Down
value.desc: When the Pokémon is hit by an attack, it scatters cotton fluff around and lowers the Speed stat of all Pokémon except itself.

name: Eldegoss
desc1: The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that plants and other Pokémon can benefit from them.
desc2: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.

value.name: Regenerator
value.desc: Restores a little HP when withdrawn from battle.

value.name: Cotton Down
value.desc: When the Pokémon is hit by an attack, it scatters cotton fluff around and lowers the Speed stat of all Pokémon except itself.

name: Wooloo
desc1: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.
desc2: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.

value.name: Run Away
value.desc: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

value.name: Fluffy
value.desc: Halves the damage taken from moves that make direct contact, but doubles that of Fire-type moves.

name: Dubwool
desc1: Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You’ll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.
desc2: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.

value.name: Steadfast
value.desc: The Pokémon's determination boosts the Speed stat each time the Pokémon flinches.

value.name: Fluffy
value.desc: Halves the damage taken from moves that make direct contact, but doubles that of Fire-type moves.

name: Chewtle
desc1: Apparently the itch of its teething impels it to snap its jaws at anything in front of it.
desc2: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.

value.name: Shell Armor
value.desc: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

value.name: Strong Jaw
value.desc: The Pokémon's strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.

name: Drednaw
desc1: With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey.
desc2: This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.

value.name: Shell Armor
value.desc: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

value.name: Strong Jaw
value.desc: The Pokémon's strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.

name: Yamper
desc1: This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.
desc2: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.

value.name: Ball Fetch
value.desc: If the Pokémon is not holding an item, it will fetch the Poké Ball from the first failed throw of the battle.

name: Boltund
desc1: This Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.
desc2: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.

value.name: Strong Jaw
value.desc: The Pokémon's strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.

name: Rolycoly
desc1: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.
desc2: It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.

value.name: Heatproof
value.desc: The heatproof body of the Pokémon halves the damage from Fire-type moves that hit it.

value.name: Steam Engine
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat drastically if hit by a Fire- or Water-type move.

name: Carkol
desc1: It forms coal inside its body. Coal dropped by this Pokémon once helped fuel the lives of people in the Galar region.
desc2: By rapidly rolling its legs, it can travel at over 18 mph. The temperature of the flames it breathes exceeds 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

value.name: Flame Body
value.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.

value.name: Steam Engine
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat drastically if hit by a Fire- or Water-type move.

name: Coalossal
desc1: It’s usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
desc2: While it’s engaged in battle, its mountain of coal will burn bright red, sending off sparks that scorch the surrounding area.

value.name: Flame Body
value.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.

value.name: Steam Engine
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat drastically if hit by a Fire- or Water-type move.

name: Applin
desc1: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it’s just an apple and nothing more.
desc2: As soon as it’s born, it burrows into an apple. Not only does the apple serve as its food source, but the flavor of the fruit determines its evolution.

value.name: Gluttony
value.desc: Makes the Pokémon eat a held Berry when its HP drops to half or less, which is sooner than usual.

value.name: Ripen
value.desc: Ripens Berries and doubles their effect.

name: Flapple
desc1: It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.
desc2: It flies on wings of apple skin and spits a powerful acid. It can also change its shape into that of an apple.

value.name: Gluttony
value.desc: Makes the Pokémon eat a held Berry when its HP drops to half or less, which is sooner than usual.

value.name: Ripen
value.desc: Ripens Berries and doubles their effect.

name: Appletun
desc1: Eating a sweet apple caused its evolution. A nectarous scent wafts from its body, luring in the bug Pokémon it preys on.
desc2: Its body is covered in sweet nectar, and the skin on its back is especially yummy. Children used to have it as a snack.

value.name: Gluttony
value.desc: Makes the Pokémon eat a held Berry when its HP drops to half or less, which is sooner than usual.

value.name: Ripen
value.desc: Ripens Berries and doubles their effect.

name: Silicobra
desc1: As it digs, it swallows sand and stores it in its neck pouch. The pouch can hold more than 17 pounds of sand.
desc2: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.

value.name: Shed Skin
value.desc: The Pokémon may heal its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

value.name: Sand Spit
value.desc: The Pokémon creates a sandstorm when it's hit by an attack.

name: Sandaconda
desc1: When it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of sand sprays from its nose. If it ever runs out of sand, it becomes disheartened.
desc2: Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand out of its sand sac more efficiently.

value.name: Shed Skin
value.desc: The Pokémon may heal its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

value.name: Sand Spit
value.desc: The Pokémon creates a sandstorm when it's hit by an attack.

name: Cramorant
desc1: It’s so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it’s battling midfight.
desc2: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.

value.name: Gulp Missile
value.desc: When the Pokémon uses Surf or Dive, it will come back with prey. When it takes damage, it will spit out the prey to attack.

name: Arrokuda
desc1: If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It’s very proud of that jaw.
desc2: After it’s eaten its fill, its movements become extremely sluggish. That’s when Cramorant swallows it up.

value.name: Swift Swim
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

name: Barraskewda
desc1: This Pokémon has a jaw that’s as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda’s flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.
desc2: It spins its tail fins to propel itself, surging forward at speeds of over 100 knots before ramming prey and spearing into them.

value.name: Swift Swim
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

name: Toxel
desc1: It stores poison in an internal poison sac and secretes that poison through its skin. If you touch this Pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.
desc2: It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison to produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it can cause a tingling paralysis.

value.name: Static
value.desc: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity, so contact with it may cause paralysis.

value.name: Rattled
value.desc: Dark-, Ghost-, and Bug-type moves scare the Pokémon and boost its Speed stat.

name: Toxtricity
desc1: Capable of generating 15,000 volts of electricity, this Pokémon looks down on all that would challenge it.
desc2: It has an electrical organ on its chest. While generating electricity, it fills its surroundings with what sounds like the strumming of a bass guitar.

value.name: Minus
value.desc: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

value.name: Punk Rock
value.desc: Boosts the power of sound-based moves.  The Pokémon also takes half the damage from these kinds of moves.

name: Sizzlipede
desc1: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.
desc2: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.

value.name: Flash Fire
value.desc: Powers up the Pokémon's Fire-type moves if it's hit by one.

value.name: White Smoke
value.desc: The Pokémon is protected by its white smoke, which prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.

name: Centiskorch
desc1: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.
desc2: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has large and very sharp fangs.

value.name: Flash Fire
value.desc: Powers up the Pokémon's Fire-type moves if it's hit by one.

value.name: White Smoke
value.desc: The Pokémon is protected by its white smoke, which prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.

name: Clobbopus
desc1: It’s very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.
desc2: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn’t alarmed when that happens—it knows they’ll grow back. It’s about as smart as a three-year-old.

value.name: Limber
value.desc: Its limber body protects the Pokémon from paralysis.

name: Grapploct
desc1: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.
desc2: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.

value.name: Limber
value.desc: Its limber body protects the Pokémon from paralysis.

name: Sinistea
desc1: This Pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.
desc2: The teacup in which this Pokémon makes its home is a famous piece of antique tableware. Many forgeries are in circulation.

value.name: Weak Armor
value.desc: Physical attacks to the Pokémon lower its Defense stat but sharply raise its Speed stat.

name: Polteageist
desc1: This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.
desc2: Leaving leftover black tea unattended is asking for this Pokémon to come along and pour itself into it, turning the tea into a new Polteageist.

value.name: Weak Armor
value.desc: Physical attacks to the Pokémon lower its Defense stat but sharply raise its Speed stat.

name: Hatenna
desc1: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures’ emotions. If you don’t have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.
desc2: If this Pokémon senses a strong emotion, it will run away as fast as it can. It prefers areas without people.

value.name: Anticipation
value.desc: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon's dangerous moves.

value.name: Healer
value.desc: Sometimes heals an ally's status condition.

name: Hattrem
desc1: No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence you violently.
desc2: Using the braids on its head, it pummels foes to get them to quiet down. One blow from those braids would knock out a professional boxer.

value.name: Anticipation
value.desc: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon's dangerous moves.

value.name: Healer
value.desc: Sometimes heals an ally's status condition.

name: Hatterene
desc1: It emits psychic power strong enough to cause headaches as a deterrent to the approach of others.
desc2: If you’re too loud around it, you risk being torn apart by the claws on its tentacle. This Pokémon is also known as the Forest Witch.

value.name: Anticipation
value.desc: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon's dangerous moves.

value.name: Healer
value.desc: Sometimes heals an ally's status condition.

name: Impidimp
desc1: Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations produced by people and Pokémon when they feel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.
desc2: It sneaks into people’s homes, stealing things and feasting on the negative energy of the frustrated occupants.

value.name: Frisk
value.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.

value.name: Prankster
value.desc: Gives priority to a status move.

name: Morgrem
desc1: When it gets down on all fours as if to beg for forgiveness, it’s trying to lure opponents in so that it can stab them with its spear-like hair.
desc2: With sly cunning, it tries to lure people into the woods. Some believe it to have the power to make crops grow.

value.name: Frisk
value.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.

value.name: Prankster
value.desc: Gives priority to a status move.

name: Grimmsnarl
desc1: With the hair wrapped around its body helping to enhance its muscles, this Pokémon can overwhelm even Machamp.
desc2: Its hairs work like muscle fibers. When its hairs unfurl, they latch on to opponents, ensnaring them as tentacles would.

value.name: Frisk
value.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.

value.name: Prankster
value.desc: Gives priority to a status move.

name: Obstagoon
desc1: Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.
desc2: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.

value.name: Guts
value.desc: It's so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat.

value.name: Reckless
value.desc: Powers up moves that have recoil damage.

name: Perrserker
desc1: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.
desc2: After many battles, it evolved dangerous claws that come together to form daggers when extended.

value.name: Battle Armor
value.desc: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

value.name: Tough Claws
value.desc: Powers up moves that make direct contact.

name: Cursola
desc1: Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémon’s core spirit.
desc2: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. You’ll become stiff as stone if you touch it.

value.name: Weak Armor
value.desc: Physical attacks to the Pokémon lower its Defense stat but sharply raise its Speed stat.

name: Sirfetch’d
desc1: Only Farfetch’d that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon’s leek withers, it will retire from combat.
desc2: After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield, it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek stalk is both weapon and food.

value.name: Steadfast
value.desc: The Pokémon's determination boosts the Speed stat each time the Pokémon flinches.

name: Mr. Rime
desc1: It’s highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.
desc2: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.

value.name: Tangled Feet
value.desc: Raises evasiveness if the Pokémon is confused.

value.name: Screen Cleaner
value.desc: When the Pokémon enters a battle, the effects of Light Screen, Reflect, and Aurora Veil are nullified for both opposing and ally Pokémon.

name: Runerigus
desc1: A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.
desc2: Never touch its shadowlike body, or you’ll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.

value.name: Wandering Spirit
value.desc: The Pokémon exchanges Abilities with a Pokémon that hits it with a move that makes direct contact.

name: Milcery
desc1: This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.
desc2: They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery is guaranteed success and good fortune.

value.name: Sweet Veil
value.desc: Prevents itself and ally Pokémon from falling asleep.

name: Alcremie
desc1: When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it's decorated with cream.
desc2: When Alcremie is content, the cream it secretes from its hands becomes sweeter and richer.

value.name: Sweet Veil
value.desc: Prevents itself and ally Pokémon from falling asleep.

name: Falinks
desc1: Five of them are troopers, and one is the brass. The brass’s orders are absolute.
desc2: The six of them work together as one Pokémon. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.

value.name: Battle Armor
value.desc: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Pincurchin
desc1: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.
desc2: It stores electricity in each spine. Even if one gets broken off, it still continues to emit electricity for at least three hours.

value.name: Lightning Rod
value.desc: The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves.  Instead of being hit by Electric-type moves,  it boosts its Sp. Atk.

name: Snom
desc1: It spits out thread imbued with a frigid sort of energy and uses it to tie its body to branches, disguising itself as an icicle while it sleeps.
desc2: It eats snow that piles up on the ground. The more snow it eats, the bigger and more impressive the spikes on its back grow.

value.name: Shield Dust
value.desc: This Pokémon's dust blocks the additional effects of attacks taken.

name: Frosmoth
desc1: Icy scales fall from its wings like snow as it flies over fields and mountains. The temperature of its wings is less than −290 degrees Fahrenheit.
desc2: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.

value.name: Shield Dust
value.desc: This Pokémon's dust blocks the additional effects of attacks taken.

name: Stonjourner
desc1: It stands in grasslands, watching the sun’s descent from zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.
desc2: Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in a circle.

value.name: Power Spot
value.desc: Just being next to the Pokémon powers up moves.

name: Eiscue
desc1: It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to make sure it stays nice and cold.
desc2: This Pokémon keeps its heat-sensitive head cool with ice. It fishes for its food, dangling its single hair into the sea to lure in prey.

value.name: Ice Face
value.desc: The Pokémon's ice head can take a physical attack as a substitute, but the attack also changes the Pokémon's appearance. The ice will be restored when it hails.

name: Indeedee
desc1: It uses the horns on its head to sense the emotions of others. Males will act as valets for those they serve, looking after their every need.
desc2: Through its horns, it can pick up on the emotions of creatures around it. Positive emotions are the source of its strength.

value.name: Inner Focus
value.desc: The Pokémon's intensely focused, and that protects the Pokémon from flinching.

value.name: Synchronize
value.desc: The attacker will receive the same status condition if it inflicts a burn, poison, or paralysis to the Pokémon.

name: Morpeko
desc1: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It’s also generating electricity.
desc2: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if they’re precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.

value.name: Hunger Switch
value.desc: The Pokémon changes its form, alternating between its Full Belly Mode and Hangry Mode after the end of each turn.

name: Cufant
desc1: It digs up the ground with its trunk. It’s also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.
desc2: If a job requires serious strength, this Pokémon will excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the rain, turning a vibrant green color.

value.name: Sheer Force
value.desc: Removes additional effects to increase the power of moves when attacking.

name: Copperajah
desc1: They came over from another region long ago and worked together with humans. Their green skin is resistant to water.
desc2: These Pokémon live in herds. Their trunks have incredible grip strength, strong enough to crush giant rocks into powder.

value.name: Sheer Force
value.desc: Removes additional effects to increase the power of moves when attacking.

name: Dracozolt
desc1: In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.
desc2: The powerful muscles in its tail generate its electricity. Compared to its lower body, its upper half is entirely too small.

value.name: Volt Absorb
value.desc: Restores HP if hit by an Electric-type move instead of taking damage.

value.name: Hustle
value.desc: Boosts the Attack stat, but lowers accuracy.

name: Arctozolt
desc1: The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.
desc2: This Pokémon lived on prehistoric seashores and was able to preserve food with the ice on its body. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.

value.name: Static
value.desc: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity, so contact with it may cause paralysis.

value.name: Volt Absorb
value.desc: Restores HP if hit by an Electric-type move instead of taking damage.

name: Dracovish
desc1: Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.
desc2: Its mighty legs are capable of running at speeds exceeding 40 mph, but this Pokémon can’t breathe unless it’s underwater.

value.name: Water Absorb
value.desc: Restores HP if hit by a Water-type move instead of taking damage.

value.name: Strong Jaw
value.desc: The Pokémon's strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.

name: Arctovish
desc1: Though it’s able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.
desc2: The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but breathing difficulties made this Pokémon go extinct anyway.

value.name: Water Absorb
value.desc: Restores HP if hit by a Water-type move instead of taking damage.

value.name: Ice Body
value.desc: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in a hailstorm.

name: Duraludon
desc1: Its body resembles polished metal, and it’s both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.
desc2: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.

value.name: Light Metal
value.desc: Halves the Pokémon's weight.

value.name: Heavy Metal
value.desc: Doubles the Pokémon's weight.

name: Dreepy
desc1: After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.
desc2: If this weak Pokémon is by itself, a mere child could defeat it. But if Dreepy has friends to help it train, it can evolve and become much stronger.

value.name: Clear Body
value.desc: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

value.name: Infiltrator
value.desc: Passes through the opposing Pokémon's barrier,  substitute, and the like and strikes.

name: Drakloak
desc1: It’s capable of flying faster than 120 mph. It battles alongside Dreepy and dotes on them until they successfully evolve.
desc2: Without a Dreepy to place on its head and care for, it gets so uneasy it’ll try to substitute any Pokémon it finds for the missing Dreepy.

value.name: Clear Body
value.desc: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

value.name: Infiltrator
value.desc: Passes through the opposing Pokémon's barrier,  substitute, and the like and strikes.

name: Dragapult
desc1: When it isn’t battling, it keeps Dreepy in the holes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches the Dreepy like supersonic missiles.
desc2: Apparently the Dreepy inside Dragapult’s horns eagerly look forward to being launched out at Mach speeds.

value.name: Clear Body
value.desc: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

value.name: Infiltrator
value.desc: Passes through the opposing Pokémon's barrier,  substitute, and the like and strikes.

name: Zacian
desc1: Known as a legendary hero, this Pokémon absorbs metal particles, transforming them into a weapon it uses to battle.
desc2: This Pokémon has slumbered for many years. Some say it’s Zamazenta’s elder sister—others say the two Pokémon are rivals.

value.name: Intrepid Sword
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat when the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Zamazenta
desc1: In times past, it worked together with a king of the people to save the Galar region. It absorbs metal that it then uses in battle.
desc2: This Pokémon slept for aeons while in the form of a statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot that it ever existed.

value.name: Dauntless Shield
value.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Defense stat when the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Eternatus
desc1: The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating from the lands of the Galar region. This energy is what allows Eternatus to stay active.
desc2: It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years ago. There seems to be a connection between this Pokémon and the Dynamax phenomenon.

value.name: Pressure
value.desc: By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.

name: Kubfu
desc1: Kubfu trains hard to perfect its moves. The moves it masters will determine which form it takes when it evolves.
desc2: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.

value.name: Inner Focus
value.desc: The Pokémon's intensely focused, and that protects the Pokémon from flinching.

name: Urshifu
desc1: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in the one-hit KO. Its strategy is to leap in close to foes and land a devastating blow with a hardened fist.
desc2: Inhabiting the mountains of a distant region, this Pokémon races across sheer cliffs, training its legs and refining its moves.

value.name: Unseen Fist
value.desc:
If the Pokémon uses moves that make direct contact,
it can attack the target even if the target protects itself.

name: Zarude
desc1: Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack with others of its kind. It's incredibly aggressive, and the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.
desc2:
Once the vines on Zarude's body tear off, they
become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants
of the forest grow.

value.name: Leaf Guard
value.desc: Prevents status conditions in harsh sunlight.

name: Regieleki
desc1: This Pokémon is a cluster of electrical energy. It’s said that removing the rings on Regieleki’s body will unleash the Pokémon’s latent power.
desc2: Its entire body is made up of a single organ that generates electrical energy. Regieleki is capable of creating all Galar’s electricity.

value.name: Transistor
value.desc: Powers up Electric-type moves.

name: Regidrago
desc1: An academic theory proposes that Regidrago’s arms were once the head of an ancient dragon Pokémon. The theory remains unproven.
desc2: Its body is composed of crystallized dragon energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of every dragon Pokémon.

value.name: Dragon's Maw
value.desc: Powers up Dragon-type moves.

name: Glastrier
desc1: Glastrier emits intense cold from its hooves. It’s also a belligerent Pokémon—anything it wants, it takes by force.
desc2: Glastrier has tremendous physical strength, and the mask of ice covering its face is 100 times harder than diamond.

value.name: Chilling Neigh
value.desc:
When the Pokémon knocks out a target, it utters a
chilling neigh, which boosts its Attack stat.

name: Spectrier
desc1: It probes its surroundings with all its senses save one—it doesn’t use its sense of sight. Spectrier’s kicks are said to separate soul from body.
desc2: As it dashes through the night, Spectrier absorbs the life-force of sleeping creatures. It craves silence and solitude.

value.name: Grim Neigh
value.desc:
When the Pokémon knocks out a target, it utters a
terrifying neigh, which boosts its Sp. Atk stat.

name: Calyrex
desc1: Calyrex is a merciful Pokémon, capable of providing healing and blessings. It reigned over the Galar region in times of yore.
desc2: Calyrex is known in legend as a king that ruled over Galar in ancient times. It has the power to cause hearts to mend and plants to spring forth.

value.name: Unnerve
value.desc: Unnerves opposing Pokémon and makes them unable to eat Berries.
